loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una señorita trabajadora de 32 años de edad, Soltera, quien vive en el departamento de El Quiche. La actividad productiva es la elaboración y venta de tejidos típicos, la venta lo realiza en los alrededores de su comunidad, es una actividad con potencial en las comunidades que utilizan los trajes típicos, lleva doce años en el negocio, en sus tiempo libre se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), así obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos para contribuir al sostenimiento de su familia. Está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para la compra de un lote de terreno. La meta es lograr construir su propia vivienda, actualmente vive con sus padres.
texts.en: María is a hardworking young woman of 32.  She is single and lives in the department of El Quiche. Her business involves making and selling typical local textiles, selling them around her village. It is a business which has potential in the villages where people use traditional costumes.  She has been running her business for 12 year.  In her free time, she grows basic grains (corn and beans), and that it is how she earns most of her income which she uses to support her family. She is applying for a loan of 700,000 quetzals to buy a parcel of land. Her ambition is to build her own home, as she currently lives with her parents.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks to build a sink and a bath and to pay to have electricity installed.

loans.name: Salaka

texts.en:
Salaka is a 24-year-old married woman with one son who is too young for school. She is from Maynaguri. Both Salaka and her husband, Dwipen, have received a primary level education. She lives in the small town of Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri.  They have a kachha house (made of mud and bamboo).

Her husband is a mason by profession, engaged with a shuttering business of centering work on houses. Centering is a type of framework temporary structure upon which the stones of an arch or vault are laid during construction.

Salaka is a housewife who always supports her family and her husband. She is active and energetic. She wants to get ahead and get over all the financial hurdles. They need to expand the business in order to strengthen their economic condition. Now her husband wants to buy some tools and wood for his business. Salaka has decided to help her husband and take a loan to purchase materials for the business.

So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). With the help of the loan, her husband will be able to buy wood and necessary tools to prepare foundations for many houses. With the profit, she hopes to enhance her husband’s business and earn more, which will increase her family’s financial status. She wants to save money to construct a decent and better house with basic facilities for them.

Salaka is thanking BJS and Kiva for supporting them financially.

loans.use: To purchase wood and necessary materials for the shuttering business.

loans.name: Sundari

texts.en:
Sundari is a 28-year-old married woman who is hardworking and optimistic. She strives tirelessly to earn an income with her husband to help with the household finances and their children's educations. She is from the small village of Sahapara in the district of Jalpaiguri and lives with her husband, Manaj. They are educated till primary level. Their three daughters are in grades 9, 5 and 1. 

To make earning for the family, Sundari is engaged in a cut piece cloth business and her husband is also engaged with the same business. He purchases bales of fabrics from wholesale sellers and supplies the local retail shops as well as the neighborhoods. These are the incomes they make to cover the necessary family expenses, which include the educational expenses of their daughters. Now they want to expand their business by selling more fabrics in order to earn more and cope with the present economic situation.

She is asking for this loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more fabric for their business. This way, she can satisfy her customers' wants and needs, and improve her sales and income through her labor.

Sundari’s main purpose is to continue working for her family's well being. She will continue working with effort and dedication to accredit her business and guarantee her family's financial stability so she can enjoy a better quality of life with her loved ones. Her dream is to provide her children with better education, food and health.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for her business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo de 65 años de edad vive con su esposa. Él posee un molino de nixtamal, desde hace 20 años y su experiencia le ha permitido que cada vez sean mas las personas que lo buscan para moler los diferentes granos como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, etc. Su esposa lo apoya en los gastos del hogar con las ganancias que le deja la tienda que se encuentra en su domicilio al igual que el molino. Ricardo desea construir un corredor frente a su vivienda el cual, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso y lamina, polines y pernos para el techo de el patio de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 65 years old and lives with his wife. He has owned a nixtamal (grain) milling machine for 20 years, and his experience with this means that ever more people seek him out in order to mill different grains such as maize, rice, beans etc.

His wife contributes to the household expenses with the profits of a shop that is situated in their home, as is the mill.

Ricardo wishes to build a corridor in front of his house. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor, and steel sheets, roofing supports and bolts for the roof of the patio of his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor, and steel sheets, roofing supports and bolts for the roof of the patio of his house.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 59 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emma has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, four of whom are in school. Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell peanut business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and corn. 

Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell for her buy and sell peanut business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Ilma Tomasa

texts.es:
Ilma es una mujer trabajadora de 42 años de edad, casada, tiene cinco hijos, cuatro varones y una mujer, quienes viven en el departamento de Sololá. La actividad productiva es la elaboración de trajes típicos (cortes, blusas entre otros), es una actividad rentable, la venta lo realiza en los mercados de su comunidad, lleva quince años en el negocio, experiencia que ha demostrado a su mercado meta, además se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, especialmente el cultivo de maíz y haba, así obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos para sostener a su familia.
Está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la compra de materiales (hilos, herramientas, tela entre otros) para la elaboración de bordados típicos. La meta es lograr adquirir un terreno y poder construir su propia vivienda así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Ilma is a hardworking woman of 42 who is married with 5 children (4 boys and one girl), who all live in the department of Sololá. Her business involves making traditional costumes (shirts and blouses amongst other things). It is a profitable business and she sells her clothing in the markets in her town. She has been running her business for fifteen years and has demonstrated this experience to her target market. She also grows vegetables (especially corn and beans) which enables her to earn most her income which she uses to support her family. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 quetzals to buy materials (thread, equipment, fabric amongst other things) for her traditional embroidery.  Her ambition is to buy some land so she can build her own home and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Gegie

texts.en:
Gegie is 47 years old and married with one child who is in school. Gegie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Gegie has been in this business for 13 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 58 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Magdalena has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for seven years and also earns an income from farming corn.

Magdalena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra, age 32 years, hails from a small village of Maynaguri. She is a married woman with three children (one son and two daughters). All of them are students of different grades. Sumitra is illiterate and only can sign her name. She did not get the opportunity to study as her family could not provide it.

Sumitra’s husband, Amal, age 41 years, is a farmer by profession. He grows seasonal vegetables on his farmland. He sells his produce in the local market. He has been engaged in this business for many years.
   
Sumitra is an active, diligent and hardworking lady. She gives financial support to her family by engaging in a milk-selling business. She has one dairy cow. She sells milk to her neighbors. 

In order to expand her business for better income, she wants to purchase one more dairy cow. So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She hopes the loan will help her to earn more to reach her goals. She wants to give economic stability to her family and educate her children to become professionals in future.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Pramita

texts.en:
Pramita is a 31-year-old active hardworking woman who is married and has one son. She is from Maynaguri. She is married to Dulal, age 36 years.  Pramita is uneducated and can sign her names only, but her husband has a primary education. Their only son is in grade 5. They live at Khagrabari, a remote region in the district Jalpaiguri.

For the last ten years, she and her husband have been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. They are quite popular for their skills in stitching in their tailoring business. They prepare blouses, petticoats, shirts, pants, salwar, etc. as per the orders of their customers.
 
Their combined work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when they started working. Over the years, they have established a good clientele. The customer demand is increasing day by day.  

They want cloth in variety, but Pramita and her husband's biggest challenge is capital. They cannot expand their business for insufficient capital.

In order to satisfy the customer demand and to better their economic condition, Pramita has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces. Pramita is very thankful to her lenders for the loan and hopes that this loan will further support her financially.

Her biggest dream is to provide her only son with higher education.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for their existing tailoring business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 55 years old, married, and has one child.  

Dominga is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Dominga has been raising pigs for three years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Dominga requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pig and piglets.

In the future, Dominga would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pig and piglets.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 32 years old, married, and has three children.

She earns a living by farming and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Marlyn has been farming and selling vegetables for 14 years and also earns additional income from farming corn.

Marlyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell peanut business in the Philippines. Lydia has been in this business for 10 years. Lydia earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell for her buy and sell peanut business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 41 years old, married, and has four children.

Maria Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Maria Fe requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. Maria Fe has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Maria Fe aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 54 years old and has 10 children. Vergie is married and has three children who are still in school.

Vergie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Vergie requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Vergie has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vergie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Welsonia

texts.en:
Welsonia is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Welsonia is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos)  through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Welsonia has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 53 years old and married with three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 45,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more items like rice, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Josephine aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Jessa Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jessa Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Jessa Joy is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jessa Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en: Usman is a 50-year-old farmer from Doka. As a Babban Gona member, Usman is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Usman can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Usman is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Usman said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family. In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, Usman is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба добросовестная женщина. Она родилась в 1974 году. Матлуба замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Матлуба занимается более 10 лет животноводством. Она откармливает 2 голов коровы и 2 голов барана. Она откармливает 5 месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и развевать бизнес дальше. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Matluba is an honest woman. She was born in 1974. Matluba is married and is raising two children. She is the main provider of her family as her husband is a labor migrant in the Russian Federation. Matluba has been practicing livestock breeding for more than 10 years. She is currently fattening up 2 cows and 2 sheep. She fattens them up for five months and then sells them at the local market. She wants to increase her working capital and continue to develop her business. She is requesting a loan for 2000 USD to buy cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of bags

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina works hard to support her family. Lina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Lina has been in this business for 23 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sharshakan

texts.ru: Шаршакан 63 года, вдова, Шаршакан - мать героиня, у нее 9 детей, дети для Шаршакан - главная ценность в жизни. Шаршакан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1990 году. Благодаря упорному труду Шаршакан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть скот на общую сумму 150,000 сом (KGS), также Шаршакан  выращивает на собственном участке мерою 2,70 ГА картофель и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шаршакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку еще одной дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Шаршакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы помочь сыну с постройкой дома.
texts.en: Sharshakan is 63 years old and a widow. Sharshakan is a mother-heroine - she has nine children. Sharshakan's children are the most important thing in her life. As the main source of income for her family, Sharshakan has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming since 1990. Thanks to Sharshakan's hard work, she currently has cattle worth 150,000 som (KGS). Sharshakan also has her own 2.70 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes and wheat. Her average monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Sharshakan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy another dairy cow. Sharshakan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business, which will help her son with the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Suse Mary

texts.en:
Suse Mary is 46 years old and married with two children.

Suse Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like soft drinks, rice, canned goods and other groceries.

Suse Mary has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Suse Mary aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, rice, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Analiza is borrowing 40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Analiza has been raising livestock for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Patria works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Patria requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Patria is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Román Elías

texts.es:
El señor Ramón es un hombre que vive junto con su esposa, no tiene hijos pero tiene una gran responsabilidad mantener su hogar, pagar un arrendamiento, una alimentación, servicios públicos y drogas para él y su esposa ya que tienen una edad considerable pues a su 59 años ya siente que el cuerpo se expresa y pide más cuidado y atenciones para seguir en funcionamiento. 
Su única fuente de dinero es su tienda la cual atiende todos los días, su gran debilidad es que no tiene mucho surtido tiene lo poco que la con su capital por ello para Ramón es una bendición que le puedan dar un crédito para surtir su negocio ya que cubrirá varios huecos en su negocio y tendrá más productos para ofertar a sus vecinos y clientes que le han colaborado comprándole para poder sobrevivir, el crédito lo usara en granos y abarrotes en general. Sueña con mejorar sus ventas y darle a su esposa una mujer vida pues lo apoyo en las malas y según Ramón se merece el mundo y tratara de dárselo
texts.en:
Ramón lives with his wife; he has no children, but he has a great responsibility to support his household, pay rent, food, utilities, and medicines for him and his wife, as they are both quite old at 59 years and he feels that their bodies need more care and attention to keep functioning. 

His only source of income is his shop, where he works every day. His biggest problem is that he doesn’t have much stock; he has only what his little capital allows. So it is a blessing for Ramón that he can receive a loan to stock his business, since it will cover several gaps in his business and he will have more products to offer his neighbors and customers, who have helped him to survive by buying from him. He will use the loan to buy grain and groceries in general. He dreams of improving his sales and giving his wife a better life, because she supports him in the bad times. According to Ramon, she deserves the world and he will try to give it to her.

loans.use: to buy products for the typical family pantry such as grains and groceries.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano es una persona trabajadora de 31 años de edad, Casado, tiene dos hijos varones, quien vive en el departamento de El Quiché. Su actividad productiva es la agricultura, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, debido a que es un producto consumido por la mayoría de la población y que demás se adapta al clima del lugar, lleva diez años de experiencia conociendo el proceso productivo y venta del producto, también se dedica a la albañilería, así obtiene sus ingresos para sostener a su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la compra de un lote de terreno. La meta que tiene es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudio hasta verlos graduados y darles una vida digna.
texts.en:
Mariano is a hardworking person of 31 years of age. He is married with two male children and lives in the department of El Quiché.

He earns a living through agriculture, growing corn, as this is a product consumed by the majority of the population and in addition is well adapted to the local climate. He has 10 years’ experience of the production process and selling the product. He also works as a builder. In this way he earns the income to support his family.

He is asking for a loan of Q 10,000.00 to buy a plot of land. His aim is to support his sons in their studies until he can see them graduate, and give them a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Tres lavadoras representan los ingresos de la señora María una madre soltera con dos hijos ambos menores de edad los cuales tuvo que criar ella sola pues al separarse de su esposo le abandono por completo dejando el destino de sus hijos en las manos de María. 
Como se puede observar su  casa es hecha de madera por lo que se puede concluir que vive en un barrio muy afectado por la pobreza en donde muchos no tienen acceso a varios artículos electrónicos como lavadoras desde entonces María comenzó el negocio cubriendo este déficit en su sector. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de las lavadoras y una carreta para transportarlas. El crédito significara un aumento del 66% de sus ventas pues tendrá 5 lavadoras a disposición de los clientes.
Su sueño es darle de la extrema pobreza en la que vive y poder brindarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que tengan un mejor futuro del que le toco vivir
texts.en:
Maria, a single mother with two underage children, makes her income from three washing machines. She had to raise her children on her own because after separating from her husband he completely abandoned them, leaving their destinies in the hands of Maria.
As can be seen in the photo, Maria's house is made of wood, which indicates that she lives in a neighborhood that is afflicted by poverty, and where many people don't have access to appliances such as washing machines. Maria started her business covering this deficit in the area. 
She is asking for a loan to purchase washing machines and a cart to transport them. This would signify a 66% increase in her sales, because she will have 5 washing machines available for her customers.
Her dream is to get out of the extreme poverty in which she lives and to be able to provide a good quality education for her children so that they will have a better future than she did.

loans.use: to purchase to washing machines and a cart to transport them

loans.name: Alh. Abdulkareem

texts.en: Alh. Abdulkareem is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Alh. Abdulkareem joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Sani,Talatuwa, and Zulai. Alh. Abdulkareem is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Alh. Abdulkareem will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Alh. Abdulkareem can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Alh. Abdulkareem is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Kimberly is 33 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Kimberly requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Kimberly has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Bo Katrina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Bo Katrina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from a cellular phone shop. 

Bo Katrina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell for her buy and sell used clothing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 50 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Angelita has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk, chips, bread, etc.

Salima has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Salima aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Conception works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling herbal medicine. Conception is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Conception has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Villarose

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Villarose works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Villarose is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Villarose has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of  children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing. 

Delia is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like face powder, bath soap, facial wash, toothpaste, diapers, sanitary pads, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like face powder, bath soap, facial wash, toothpaste, diapers, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure and pedicure (service) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase nail polish, a nipper, and other materials needed for her manicure and pedicure (service) business.

Jasmin has been in this business for 20 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jasmin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, a nipper, and other materials

loans.name: Rwengwara Mirembe Women Group

texts.en:
Nuliet is a member of Rwengwara Mirembe Women group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan. She deals in selling fresh foods and produce. She faces the challenge of having little capital. Besides that, she has hopes of having a good business and healthy family. 

Nuliet needs a loan to add stock of produce like rice, posho and cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to add stock of produce like rice, posho and cassava flour for selling

loans.name: Pacwa Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Annet, age 33, is married with three children, ages 7, 5 and 2. She is a farmer who grows various crops on a small scale as her major sources of income.

She has applied for a loan of ugx.1,000,000 from Ugafode to pay school fees because her dream is to see all her children finish school.

She is hardworking and honest. She and the group members are committed to pay their loan very well so that they can keep benefiting from the Kiva loan.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is 44 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Elena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Elena has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Shitu

texts.en: Shitu remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Shitu like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Shitu,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Shitu expressed that “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, Shitu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Shaibu

texts.en: Shaibu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Shaibu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Lawan, Samaila, and  Harunaa. Shaibu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Shaibu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he  would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Shaibu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Shaibu is not thinking about this year alone, he expressed that his long-term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Erlinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Sani like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Sani,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  Sani expressed that “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Sani is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina remembers her family struggling to eat 3 meals a day  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now, Amina, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Amina is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”,  expressed Amina.  With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, sheeting, and windows.

loans.name: Bikhodjal

texts.ru: Бихочал родилась в 1954 году. Она вдова. Бихочал более 22 года занимается купле продажей сухофруктов, а также она ткет киргизские ковры. Бихочал продает свою продукцию на местном рынке. Она имеет большого опыта в этой сфере. Бихочал имеет постоянных покупателей. Она является повторной клиенткой ИМОН и КИВА. Она имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Бихочал запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов для расширения бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bikhodjal was born in 1954. She is a widow. For more than 22 years, Bikhodjal has been buying and reselling dried fruit. She also weaves Kyrgyz carpets. Bikhodjal sells her goods at the local market. She has a lot of experience in this sphere. Bikhodjal has loyal customers. She is a repeat client of IMON and KIVA. She has a good credit history. Bikhodjal is requesting a loan for 10,000 somoni to buy dried fruit to expand her business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila remembers not being able to pay school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Samaila, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Samaila is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”,  expressed Samaila. With this loan, Samaila is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Arleth Yasmin

texts.es:
Arleth es una mujer bastante tenaz y siempre ha querido salir adelante con sus tres hijos y su esposo.
Su familia es la motivación más grande que tiene para trabajar incansablemente día a día para ser mejor.
Ella ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras en el municipio de Sincelejo a los habitantes que soliciten este tipo de servicios.
Al principio fue difícil iniciar ya que no tenía experiencia y le daba temor enfrentarse al mercado, pero poco a poco fue tomando más fuerza y hoy en día tiene una gran cantidad de clientes.
Ella solicita un préstamo para realizar la adecuación a un espacio que tiene en su casa y así poder guardar las 6 lavadoras con las que actualmente dispone para trabajar.
De este modo podrá trabajar de una manera más cómoda.
texts.en:
Arleth is quite a tenacious woman who has always wanted to get ahead with her three children and husband. Her family is the greatest motivation that she has to work constantly day after day to get better. She provides clothes washing machines for rent in the Municipality of Sincelejo to the people who want this type of service. In the beginning it was difficult to start as she had no experience and she was afraid to face the market. But little by little her business gained strength and today has a good number of clients.

Arleth is requesting a loan to adapt an area that she has in her house to be able to fit the 6 washing machines with which she has to work. In this way she can work in a more comfortable manner.

loans.use: adapting a space in her house to put washing machines.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru: Хамиде 41 год. Она замужем, но муж находиться за приделами страны на заработках. У нее трое детей, два сына и дочка. Дочери 18 лет, сыновьям 17 и 14 лет.  Хамида с детьми и свекровью живет в городе Душанбе. Она зарабатывает на жизнь путем предоставления услуги портнихи на дому. Она получает заказ на кройку и шитье на заказ. Ее услуги стоят не дорого, и Хамида много работает, чтобы получать больше дохода. Она работает с одной швейной машинкой несколько лет и ее машинка совсем устарела. Хамида хочет купить новую компьютерную, чтобы выполнять заказы быстрее и качественнее. Так как она не в финансовом состоянии купить желаемую швейную машинку она просит кредит.
texts.en: Hamida is 41 years old. She is married, but her husband is working abroad in neighboring countries. She has three children - two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is 18years old, and her sons are 17 and 14 years old. Hamida lives with her children and mother-in-law in the city of Dushanbe. She earns a living by offering her services as a seamstress out of her home. She takes order for cutting patterns and sewing custom-made clothes. Her services are not very expensive, so Hamida works a lot to make more profit. She has worked on one sewing machine for many years and her machine has become completely outdated. Hamida wants to buy a new, computerized sewing machine, so that she can fulfill orders quicker and with a higher quality of sewing. As she is not in the financial situation to buy her desired sewing machine herself, she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy a new, modernized sewing machine.

loans.name: Sevaroy

texts.ru:
Севарой жительница района Гиссар. Ей 27 лет. Она разведена и от брака имеет 6 летнего ребенка. Ребенок живет с ней. Севарой живет у своей мамы, кроме нее и ее ребенка с ними живет и брат Севарой. 
   Севарой на жизнь зарабатывает предоставляя услуги портнихи. Она работает на дому, для нее так работать очень удобно, потому что она может не оставлять ребенка. 
    Сейчас она просит кредит и намерена купить ткани и другие швейные принадлежности, чтобы шить платья и продавать их. Она надеется получить кредит. Севарой заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Sevaroy is a resident of the Gissar district. She is 27 years old. She is divorced and has a 6-year-old child, who lives with her. Sevaroy lives with her mother, and besides her and her child, Sevaroy's brother lives with them too. Sevaroy earns a living by providing seamstress services. She works at home because it is very convenient for her so she can be with her child. Now she is requesting a loan and intends to purchase fabrics and other sewing accessories to sew dresses and sell them. She hopes to obtain this loan. Sevaroy thanks You in advance.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Mercilinda

texts.en:
Mercilinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables and canned goods for her restaurant business.

Mercilinda has been in this business for 30 years. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Mercilinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables and canned goods.

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming sugarcane. Norlyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock like noodles, sardines and shampoo to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Norlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like noodles, sardines and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 62 years old and married with four children.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles and canned goods to sell.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lourdes aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Tito Josué

texts.es:
Tito de 29 años de edad,  estudio el bachillerato,  posteriormente siguió estudiando un técnico en computación, y luego decidió iniciar con la formación para pastor.  Está casado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar. Su hijo es menor de edad tiene 3 años. Nadie más vive con ellos.

Él se dedica al pastoreo de la comunidad, es un hombre entregado a lo espiritual. De trabajar en la comunidad tiene más de 4 años, pero de ser pastor tiene más de 10 años, su padre por medio de las correcciones que le hacía fue como lo hizo que fuera una persona de bien para la sociedad: no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pagar una deuda que tiene en una comercial, en la que adquirió una pantalla plasma al crédito, al darse cuenta que le salía demasiado caro, decidió solicita un nuevo crédito para solventar el compromiso. Se menciona que en meses anteriores se le tramito uno,  con el compro una motocicleta, es la que le sirve para salir a todos sus compromisos y ya no andar esperando bus que muchas veces era el mayor contratiempo.  

Su deseo es poder tener primero lo más necesario para sobre vivir, servirle siempre a Dios y los suyos en la comunidad, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
Tito is 29 years old who finished his Secondary school studies. After that he continued to study as a computer technician and then decided to begin his training as a Minister. He is married, his wife does the housework. He has a three year old son. No one else lives with them.

He works as the minister of his community, he is a man given up to the spiritual. He has been working in this community for 4 years but has been a minister for more than 10 years. His father through discipline he applied made him become a good person in society. He has no other work.

The loan Tito is requesting is to pay off a debt he has at a store where he bought a plasma TV set on credit and then realized that it was too expensive. So he decided to ask for a new loan to solve this commitment. He mentions that he had a loan in the past months to buy a motorcycle which helps him get to all his obligations without having to wait for buses which was his major setback. His wish is to first have all that is necessary to live and serve God and his community. So he hopes to be able to work as long as God grants him health and life.

loans.use: to pay a debt he has at a store acquiring a plasma TV set on credit.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia de 47 años de edad vive con una hermana. Ella es una mujer  tenaz que se gana la vida vendiendo vitaminas y medicamentos de forma ambulante. Alicia desea construir un servicio sanitario de fosa en su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo,cemento, arena, grava y una plancha de cemento, además pagará mano de obra para la construcción del servicio sanitario.
texts.en: Alicia is 47 years old and lives with a sister. She is a tenacious woman who has made a living selling vitamins and medications door-to-door. Alicia wants to build a washroom with a septic tank in her house. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel, a cement slab and to pay for labor to build a bathroom.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, a cement slab and to pay for labor to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Santos Hermogenes

texts.es:
El señor Santos es habitante de chichigalpa es casado tiene 9 hijos de los cuales solo 2 tiene a su cargo en edad escolar su esposa es ama de casa el cuenta con un negocio de venta de raspado desde hace 25 años de manera ambulante el señor comenzó a vender raspado con dos bolsa de hielo en una escuela cerca de su casa a prosperado su negocio ahora tiene un triciclo para vender sus raspados ambulante por las calles de chichigalpa y viaja a las comunidades mas cercanas .

el solicito este préstamo para la compra de vasos,cucharas, azúcar y frutas con las que el prepara la miel de sus raspados es un hombre trabajador que sigue luchando por sus hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Santos is a resident of Chichigalpa. He is married and has 9 kids. He takes care of just two of them, who are still attending school. His wife is a housewife. He has owned a slushy business for 25 years. He is a street seller. He started selling his slushies with two ice bags, in a school near his house. His business throve and he now has a tricycle to sell his slushies in the streets of Chichigalpa. He also travels to the nearest communities.

He requested this loan to buy cups, spoons, sugar, and fruit to prepare the honey for his slushies. He is a hard working man who keeps struggling for his younger children.

loans.use: to buy cups, spoons, and fruit.

loans.name: Rocilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, four of whom are in school, Rocilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She earns additional income from rice retailing. Rocilyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her sugarcane farming business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Rocilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hellen Isabel

texts.es: Hellen Isabel, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está soltera, vive con su hijo el cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras, esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Hellen Isabel is 22 years old. She is single and lives with her son, who is her priority. She wants to buy fertilizers, fungicides, and to pay for the labor to get the assistance for the coffee crops, with this loan. She also wants to buy some copper wood to re-sow.

 Her goal is to get more plants per area. She also wishes to take advantage of the fertility of the soil and  the weather conditions that favor coffee growing.  she hopes to get more profits with the improvement of her crops, to improve her family’s life and also to invest in the crops and to reach some other goals. It is the first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has never had any other loan from a state bank before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her many easy terms and a very low interest rate.

loans.use: to get assistance for her coffee

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, vegetables, eggs, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Rosalia has been in this business for five years. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, vegetables, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Maira

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maira works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Maira is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Maira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 62 years old and married with two children. 

Manuela is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Manuela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Manuela has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Manuela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 45 years old and has 10 children. Maria Elena is married and six of her children are currently in school.

Maria Elena is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maria Elena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Elena has been in pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es: Ceferino es una persona de 46 años de edad, Soltero, tiene 6 hijos, dos mujeres y cuatro varones, quien vive en el departamento de Sololá. Su actividad productiva es la agricultura, se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas como la siembra de granos básicos (Maíz y frijol), en la zona donde vive se adapta y desarrolla bien el cultivo, a cada dos años lo van rotando para que el suelo no pierda sus propiedades químicas y físicas, lleva con esta actividad veinte años, la venta del grano lo hace en los mercados regionales de su comunidad, además la esposa contribuye con la venta de alimentos, de ahí obtienen sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,300.00 para la compra de insumos agrícola, principalmente fertilizante y abono orgánico  para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. La meta que tiene es lograr buenos rendimientos de los cultivos y abastecer el mercado regional con un producto de calidad.
texts.en:
Ceferino is 46 years old. He is single, he has 6 children, two of whom are females and the other four are males. He lives in the municipality of Solola. His main occupation is farming. He grows vegetables such as basic grains (corn and beans). The area where he lives at is good for the crops. He rotates the crops every two years so the soil doesn’t loss its chemical and physical properties. He is being doing this for twenty years.

 He sells the grains in the local markets. The wife also contributes selling food, and that’s how they get the income to support the family. 

He is requesting a loan of Q 2,300.00 to buy farming supplies, mainly fertilizers and organic compost to cultivate corn and beans. His goal is to get a good crop and to be able to supply the local market with a good quality product.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil for her food vending business.

Romelyn has been in this business for seven years. Romelyn earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, so she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil for her food vending business.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime ha tenido que soportar el duro verdugo del desplazamiento a causa de la violencia, se vio en la obligación de trasladarse hasta Bello en busca de una nueva oportunidad de vida para él, su esposa y sus hijos lejos de la violencia, la sangre y las balas.
Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa en la cual se gana la vida vendiendo helados caseros, frituras, alimentos como empanadas, buñuelos y minutos a celular, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para sus hijos.
El solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de surtido para su pequeño negocio y en arreglos para el sitio de trabajo.
Con este préstamo para ofrecer una mejor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.
Hoy en día es un hombre fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Jaime has had to withstand the cruel torment of being displaced because of violence. He was obliged to move to Bello looking for a new opportunity in life his wife and his children far from the violence, blood and bullets.

Today he lives in a modest house where he makes his living selling homemade ice-cream, fried foods, empanadas, doughnuts, and cell phone minutes. This is an activity that he learned empirically in his eagerness to provide sustenance for his children.

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of stock for his small business and make some improvements to his work place. With the loan he will be able to provide a greater variety of products and improve his sales considerably. Today he is strong man with a good entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to buy stock and make improvements at his work site.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: Lawal is a 30 year old farmer from Bazana. As a Babban Gona member, Lawal, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Lawal can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Lawal is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Lawal said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland, in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Lawal is on his way to achieving this dream

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 48 years old and has five children. Nora is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Nora is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Nora has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Nora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Mujittafa Maintai

texts.en: Mujittafa Mainta is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Mujittafa Mainta joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Marawuya,Mustapha, and Hafizu. Mujittafa Mainta is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Mujittafa Mainta will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Mujittafa Mainta can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Mujittafa Mainta is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Hamisu,Shehu, and Zainura. Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ibrahim will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ibrahim can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Ibrahim is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Rev. Bitrus Fasto

texts.en: Rev. Bitrus Fasto is a farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Rev. Bitrus Fasto is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rev. Bitrus Fasto can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Rev. Bitrus Fasto is ambitious and is aiming to reap 70 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Gaius, Yafta, and  Benjamin. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола родилась в 1967 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она воспитывает своих детей в духе патриотизма. Лола хочет организовать свой бизнес, так как она нуждается в деньгах. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она хочет организовать бизнес предоставлением услуги швеи, так как она умеет шить национальные женские платья. Она с такой целью обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 550 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lola was born in 1967. She is married and has three children who are raised to be proud of their country. Lola's husband is a migrant worker in Russia. She wants to start a new sewing business since she knows how to sew traditional dresses and she needs money. With this goal in mind, she took the "Achieve Success" course organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She is requesting a loan of 550 somoni to buy a sewing machine and she awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts, overhaul, and maintain a mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her place of business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 42-years-old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Flora works very hard to provide for them.

Flora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like seasonings, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, cereals, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Flora has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as seasonings, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Flora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock like seasonings, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 44 years old and has four children. Veronica is married and two of her children are in school.

Veronica is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Dayabu

texts.en: Dayabu remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Dayabu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Dayabu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Dayabu. With this loan, Dayabu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Rahidu

texts.en: Rahidu is a 26-year-old farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Rahidu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rahidu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Rahidu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  60 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Rahidu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children. Rahidu’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” he said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Maria Valentina

texts.es:
La señora  Valentina de 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia casa propia en una comunidad de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 40  años a la Ganadería. 
Doña Valentina está solicitando el préstamo para compra de  novillos para repasto y aumentar su producción su sueño es ver su hacienda prospera y seguir apoyando a su familia e hijos.
Doña Valentina uno de sus sueño es ver su negocio crecer y poder salir adelante con sus hijos.


 Trojes, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Mrs. Valentina is 55 years old, lives with her husband, and has two dependent children. She resides in her own house in the community of Trojes in eastern Honduras. She has been dedicated to cattle-raising for the last 40 years.

Mrs. Valentina is requesting a loan for purchasing young bulls to put out to pasture and increase her production. Her dream is to see her farm prosper and to continue helping her family and children.         

One of Mrs. Valentina's dreams is to see her business grow and to be able to advance with her children.

Trojes, Honduras – June 2014

loans.use: to buy young bulls for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Ivy

texts.en:
Ma. Ivy is 27 years old. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Ivy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Ivy has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ma. Ivy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 30-years-old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lucia has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Lucia has taken a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lucia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy enough goods such as rice, salt, red oil, union, etc.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Yahaya, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yahaya  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Yahaya   With this loan, Yahaya is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Fatsima

texts.en: Fatsima remembers not being able to feed her family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Fatsima, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  However, Fatsima  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 16 bags per hectare this season, higher than the national average of 14.   “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Fatsima.  With this loan, Fatsima is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en: Inusa remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Inusa, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Inusa  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” expressed Inusa   With this loan, Inusa is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.ru:
Наталья замужем. У нее два взрослых сына. Наталья имеет свой бизнес.

Наталья занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий. Торговое место на рынке арендует. Опыт работы у Натальи 15 лет. Наиболее популярными являются печенье  и конфеты.  В будущем она хочет расширить  ассортимент товара. Наталья коммуникабельная и приветливая,  что привлекает клиентов.

Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на расширение ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Natalia is married and has two adult sons. Natalia has her own business. She is involved in selling sweets and confectionery goods. She leases her retail space at a market.
