Natalia has 15 years of work experience. Her most popular items are cookies and candies. In the future, she wants to expand the selection of products. Natalia is an engaging and friendly person, which attracts customers. Natalia is requesting a loan in the amount of 5 000 hryvnia to expand her product selection.

loans.use: to expand her product selection

loans.name: Mariquita

texts.en:
Mariquita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business. Mariquita been a member of NWTF since 2013 and is now requesting a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Mariquita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Mariquita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 47 years old and married with three children, two currently in school. Josefa works very hard to provide for her family.

Josefa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Josefa has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, beers, shampoo, and soft drinks. 

In the future, Josefa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Гулчехра веселая, добродушная женщина. Ей 39 лет. Она имеет троих детей. Старший сын в этом году поступил в университет. У
Гулчехры очень дружная  семья. С мужем они работают для благополучия семьи, чтобы дети жили в достатке. Муж Гулчехры Ойбек работает в Р.Ф.  таксистом. Сама Гулчехра торгует на центральном рынке района. У нее имеется не большая точка, где она продает конфеты, сладости. Товары Гулчехра привозит с города. Дела у Гулчехры идут хорошо, и она еще больше хотела бы  разнообразить ассортимент товара и умножить их количество в летний сезон, когда свадьбы и мероприятия проводяться часто. Но ей для товарооборота не хватает денежных средств. Поэтому Гулчехра в очередной раз обратилась в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом. Она очень надеется что  Арванд, поддержит, ее своевременно окажет ей финансовую помощь.  Гулчехра  выражает свою благодарность организации и наконец, хотела бы отметить «ведь благодаря таким организациям как Арванд жизнь местных жителей улучшается, и дела начинающих предпринимателей идут вперед.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a cheerful, good-natured woman. She is 39 years old. She has three children. Her eldest son enrolled in university this year. Gulchehra has a really close-knit family. She and her husband work for wellbeing of their family, so that their children want for nothing. Gulchehra's husband, Oybek, works in the Russian Federation as a taxi driver. Gulchehra works in retail sale in the district's central market. She has a small stall where she sells candy and sweets. Gulchehra's merchandise is brought in from the city. Gulchehra's business does very well and she would really like to diversify her assortment of merchandise and multiply her inventory for the summer season, when weddings and celebrations happen frequently. But she does not have enough money for this turnover. This is why Gulchehra turned to MDO "Arvand" for once again to request a loan. She really hopes that Arvand will support her and offer her timely financial assistance. Gulchehra expresses her thanks to the organization and finally, would like to add, "Thanks to organizations like Arvand, the life of local residents truly is improving and the business of first-time entrepreneurs progresses."

loans.use: to buy an assortment of sweets to increase her sales turnover.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 46 years old and married. Elena has five children, two of whom are in school.

Elena is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elena has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 23 years old and married. She has one child who is in school. Rowena works very hard to provide for her family.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is a 37-year-old married woman with six children, five in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Luna has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Luna requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Luna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Luna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is a 36-year-old married woman with five children, all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Annalyn has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. Annalyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her mat-weaving.

Annalyn has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Annalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her mat-weaving business.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family. Ma. Teresa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Teresa requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 54 years old and married with five children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Aida has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Aida has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marie Cris

texts.en:
Marie Cris is 27 years old and married with three children, two in school. Marie Cris works very hard to provide for her family.

Marie Cris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase shampoo, coffee, sugar, candies, detergent soap, milk, juice, etc. to sell.

Marie Cris has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marie Cris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, coffee, sugar, candies, detergent soap, milk, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cindirila

texts.en:
Cindirila is a 34-year-old married woman with five children, all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Cindirila has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. Cindirila requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her mat-weaving.

Cindirila has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Cindirila would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her mat-weaving.

loans.name: Muhaiyo

texts.ru: Мухайе  жительница сельской местности. Мухайе замужем и имеет 3 детей. Мухайе выросла в многодетной семье и ее родителям приходилось работать целыми днями чтобы обеспечить все потребности семьи. Мухайе с детства привыкла к тяжелому труду. Мухайе начала заниматься бизнесом в молодости и начальный капитал для бизнеса она заработала работая на поле. Она начинала с малого, занимаясь привозом товаров с города и перепродавая их возле дома в розницу. Постепенно она увеличила свой товарооборот и открыла небольшой магазин около своего дома где продает продукты питания . Муж Мухайе работает мастером в строительной бригаде в России и каждый сезон уезжает на заработки. Основным источником дохода является ее магазин так, как муж не всегда зарабатывает в России. Сейчас в связи с сезонностью выручка у Мухайе упала и ей нужны деньги для закупки товаров. Она обратилась в «Арванд» за финансовой помощью и она надеется , что ей помогут. Мухайе заранее  благодарна  за поддержку жителей сельских местностей.
texts.en: Muhaiyo is a resident of a rural village. Muhaiyo is married and has three children. Muhaiyo grew up in a family with many children. Her parents worked all day to provide their children with all of the necessities. Muhaiyo has been accustomed to hard work since childhood. Muhaiyo started her own business when she was young. She earned the start-up capital for the business working in the fields. She started small, transporting merchandise from the city and reselling it out of her home. Little by little, she increased her sales turnover and opened a small store near her house where she sells groceries. Muhaiyo's husband works as a foreman in a construction brigade in Russia and every season he leaves to work abroad. The store serves as her main source of income as her husband does not always earn money in Russia. Now, in connection with seasonality, Muhaiyo's income has fallen and she needs money to buy new merchandise. She turned to Arvand for financial assistance and she hopes that they will help her. Muhaiyo thanks them in advance for their support of rural village residents.

loans.use: to buy food to increase her sales turnover.

loans.name: Adilaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Adilaida works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming and selling vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Adilaida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables like pechay (cabbage), onions, garlic, eggplant, and squash to sell.

Adilaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like pechay (cabbage), onions, garlic, eggplant, and squash to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell.
 
Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 59 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, rice, charcoal, sugar, eggs, and groceries.

Ana has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, rice, charcoal, sugar, eggs, and groceries.

loans.name: Bikram

texts.en:
Bikram is 36 years old and a differently able man. He lives with his mother, wife, one brother, one daughter and one son in a small village of Khurda district of Odisha, India. He is engaged in a furniture making business and makes 9,000 INR per month. He is the only person from his family who earns money, so all the responsibilities are taken care of by him. He is a very hardworking and responsible man.

He is asking for a loan to purchase more wood and modern tools so that he can make more furniture for retail. He sells his furniture in Bhubaneswar (the capital city of Odisha). 

He is thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and modern tools.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Analyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fresh fish to sell.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Consolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Consolita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling school supplies, ready-to-wear clothing, and native products. Consolita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like rice, sugar, charcoal, shampoo, and groceries for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Consolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 33 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ephraim, Obida, and Amos. Musa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Musa will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Musa can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I want to ensure my children are educated.” Musa is on his way to ensuring the future of his three beloved children.

loans.use: For high quality agricultural inputs

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 37 years old and married with four children, three in school. Celia is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Celia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Celia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Celia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Celia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: P.sanju

texts.en:
P.Sanju is a 32-year-old single woman working under difficult personal circumstances. She currently lives with her father, mother, and brother in the small village of Kalipali in Khurda District. Her only source of income is from her general store, where she makes 8,500 INR per month, which is not sufficient to cover the basic expenses for her and her family's daily needs.  

She is looking to increase her sales in this store by increasing her inventory stock of stationery products to sell. This loan will help P.Sanju to not only increase her business revenue, but also create sustainability of her shop, thereby improving her and her family's overall quality of life.

loans.use: to increase her stationery inventory by purchasing pens, books, notepads, paper, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia is a 50-year-old married woman with nine children, five in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rodelia has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. Rodelia requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her mat-weaving.

Rodelia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rodelia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat-weaving.

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia de 57 años de edad vive con su hijo de 23 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida desde hace 15 años gracias a su pequeño negocio ropa como: faldas, blusas, pantalones, traje de niño, etc. María Julia desea terminar de construir las paredes de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar arena, cemento y pagar mano de obra para que le terminen de construir las paredes de su vivienda y darle así una mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Maria Julia is 57 years old and lives with her 23-year-old son.  She is an enterprising woman who for 15 years has earned a living from her small business selling clothing such as skirts, blouses, pants, children's clothing, etc.  Maria Julia wants to finish building the walls of her home, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sand and cement and to pay for labor to finish construction on the walls of her home and thereby provide her family with greater security.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement and to pay for labor to finish construction on the walls of her home to give her family more security.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Delma works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items for her tailoring business, like zippers, buttons, fabric, and thread and to pay for maintenance of her sewing machine.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Delma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, like zippers, buttons, fabrics, and thread and to pay for maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 39 years old and married with four children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, soy sauce, oil, rice, sugar, charcoal, shampoo, and groceries.

Emy has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending and raising livestock.

Emy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, soy sauce, oil, rice, sugar, charcoal, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Marquires Juan

texts.es:
Marquires un hombre de 59 años de edad, dedicado al  negocio del reciclaje, trabajo junto con su esposa diariamente pues son dos personas que solo se tienen la una a la otra y se unen para buscar tener una mejor vida pues no tienen una persona que les ayude, lo cual les ha afectado mucho pues a su edad les pesa las cosas y más aún en un trabajo donde se requiere tanta fuerza bruta. 
Solicita un crédito para tener capital disponible para la compra de aluminio y cobre, pues son los materiales más vendidos y apetecidos por sus clientes. 
Con este crédito tendrá un buen presupuesto para realizar buenas negociaciones que le permitan obtener buena ganancia para seguir sobreviviendo con su esposa.
texts.en:
Marquires is a 59-year-old man who engages in recycling; he works every day with his wife, as they only have each other and their joint energies to reach a better standard of living. They do not have someone who can help them, and this has deeply affected them, as at their age everything feels harder, especially a job like theirs that requires a lot of brute force.
He is requesting a loan to have the money he needs to buy aluminum and copper: these are the materials he sells the most, as they are the most requested by his customers.
With this loan, his budget will be good enough to cut profitable deals that will allow him to earn a sound income in order to keep on surviving with his wife.

loans.use: To buy large amounts of aluminum and copper to sell at his store.

loans.name: Elsy

texts.es: Caribañolas, arepas, patacones, empanadas, jugos naturales y otras delicias son los productos que vende Elsy en su negocio; con esta actividad ha generado ingresos desde hace 38 años, para para apoyar el sostenimiento de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y 4 hijos hoy adultos.  Esta actividad es tradicional en su familia paterna pues su madre también la desempeñó. Todos los días de lunes a domingo, Elsy en la puerta de su casa ofrece de 7 de la mañana a 9 de la mañana y desde las 4 de la tarde a 12 de la noche. Su meta es mejorar la infraestructura del negocio y mas adelante y mantenerlo en un ambiente confortable y elegante para que sus hijos la hereden. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Caribañolas, arepas, patacones, empanadas, jugos naturales. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues tendría una buena oferta y exhibición y mucha más venta.
texts.en:
Elsy has a business selling caribañolas, arepas, patacones, empanadas [traditional small meat, cheese and vegetable pies], fruit juices and other treats. 

This activity has generated income for her for 38 years and she has been able to support her family which consists of her partner and 4 children who are now adults. 

This business is a tradition in the family on her fathers side but her mother also did this type of work. 

Elsy sells her food from her door every day, Monday through Sunday, from 7-9am and from 4pm- midnight. 

Her goal is to improve the infrastructure of her business and in the future maintain it in a comfortable and elegant environment so that her children can inherit it. 

Currently shes is applying for a CrediKiva. This is the first loan by  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

She will buy caribañolas, arepas, patacones, empanadas and fruit juices. 

With this investment she hopes to improve her business by having good deals and more for sale.

loans.use: to buy caribañolas, arepas, patacones, empanadas [traditional small meat, cheese and vegetable pies] and fruit juices.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 34 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Raquel has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her mat-weaving.

Raquel has been in this business for four years. In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her mat-weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар женщина в возрасте 34 лет, имеет 3 прекрасных детей и любящего мужа. Диловар живет  в сельской местности, где уровень жизни очень низкий и поэтому женщинам приходиться трудиться наравне с мужчинами. С раннего детства Диловар помогала ухаживать отцу за баранами и выводила пастись на поле. Так Диловар полюбила эту профессию. Опыт работы в этой деятельности у Диловар большой.  Муж Диловар занимается земледелием на своей небольшой земле и по сезону ездит в Российскую Федерацию на заработки. Но тех денег что добывает муж мало  чтобы обеспечить все потребности семьи. Диловар говорит, что животноводство это основной источник дохода ее семьи.  Из за того что сейчас скот подешевел и спрос на скот снизился Диловар обратилась в «Арванд» за финансовой помощью. На полученные деньги Диловар хочет купить корм для скота и молодой скот для расширения своего бизнеса. Диловар заранее благодарна ООО МДО «Арванд» за предоставленную  финансовую помощь малоимущим слоям населения.
texts.en: Dilovar is a 34-year-old woman. She has three wonderful children and a loving husband. Dilovar lives in the countryside, where the income level is very low, which is why women go to work as well as men. From early in her childhood, Dilovar helped her father look after their sheep and put them out to pasture in the field. That is how Dilovar fell in love with this profession. Dilovar has a lot of work experience in this sphere. Dilovar's husband practices crop farming on their small plot of land. He also seasonally works abroad in the Russian Federation. But the money that her husband contributes is not enough to cover all of the family's needs. Because cattle are currently very cheap and the demand for cattle has dropped, Dilovar turned to "Arvand" for financial assistance. With the received funds, Dilovar wants to buy cattle feed and a young cow to expand her business. Dilovar thanks MDO Arvand, LLC in advance for their provided financial support to the poorest segment of the population.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and a young cow.

loans.name: Mini

texts.en:
Mini is a 33-year-old divorced woman who is struggling to make it on her own in a rural village in Ganjam District. She currently runs a small retail store where she sells cosmetics, personal care products, jewelry, and stationery items. This business was only made possible with support from her brothers and her father. 

Mini's dream is that she can eventually run this store on her own without her family's assistance. This loan will help Mini add more items to her store to increase overall sales and more importantly, allow Mini to move one step closer to achieving her lifelong goal.

loans.use: to increase sales by adding stationery items, such as pens and notepads, to her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pinezol bleach, detergent and others.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.es:
La socia Mamerta pertenece al banco comunal CAMINANDO JUNTOS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Mamerta es casada y  tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia siembra frutas como naranja entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Mamerta belongs to the CAMINANDO JUNTOS Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the district of Echarate in La Convención Province, Cusco Department.  

Mamerta is married and has three children.  She balances her daily activities with her work in farming.  She grows fruits such as oranges, among others.  She has had her business for a some time now and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to keep working so she can keep helping her family.  

She is requesting this loan to buy seed and fertilizer. 

She is thankful for the loan she has received and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Francisca pertenece al banco comunal CAMINANDO JUNTOS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Francisca es conviviente tiene 51 años de edad y  tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the “Caminando Juntos” [Walking Together] communal bank.  This bank is located in the Echarate district, in La Convención province, Cusco department.

Francisca lives with her partner.  She is 51 years old and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily chores and her business raising small farm animals.  She has been doing this business for a good while now.  Thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day, it is going very well for her.  She raises the small animals to later sell them to customers who ask for them.  She wants to be able to keep working so that, in this way, she can keep supporting her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy feed for her animals, among other items.  She is grateful for the loan that was granted and is committed to making her established payments.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals, among other purchases.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and married with three children.

Irene earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins, feed and other supplies for her livestock.

Irene has been raising livestock for four years and earns additional income from farming bananas.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store and farming rice. Gerlie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of dried coconut meat to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Gerlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice works hard to support her family. Janice is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients.

Janice has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Janice would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 43 years old and married with nine children, five in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of nipa to sell.

Lilibeth has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa roofing business for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of nipa to sell

loans.name: Maria Liezel

texts.en:
Maria Liezel is a parent of one child and works hard to support her family.

She has a fermented duck egg business in the Philippines and earns additional income from photoshop services and raising pigs. Maria Liezel is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more eggs to sell for her fermented duck egg business.

Maria Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more duck eggs to sell

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline is 39 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like salt, oil, rice, sugar, charcoal, shampoo, and groceries.

Jacquiline has borrowed and repaid 33 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and raising livestock.

Jacquiline aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like salt, oil, rice, sugar, charcoal, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Rajendra

texts.en:
Rajendra is a 48-year-old differently-abled man who lives with his wife and two sons, who are 23 years and 18 years of age, in a small village of Ganjam District of Odisha, India. Both of his sons go to university for higher education. 

Rajendra owns a grocery shop where he sells basic household items, such as sugar, edible oil, biscuits, flour, rice, etc., and makes 6,000 INR per month. It is very difficult for him to manage his family with 6,000 INR, as his sons are studying in university.

Rajendra wants to incease his monthly income by adding more household items such as tea, spices, snacks, chocolates, etc. This loan will help him make more money and create a better life for him and his family.

loans.use: to increase his income by adding more household items such as tea, spices, snacks, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Shehu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Muhamman, Sahalu, and Alhassan. Shehu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Shehu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Shehu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Shehu said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland” Shehu is not thinking about just this year. In 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Narcefa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Narcefa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming vegetables and selling charcoal. Narcefa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more dried coconut meat to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Narcefa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Nerrie

texts.en:
Nerrie is 31 years old and married, with six children. With four children in school, Nerrie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like vinegar, shampoo, charcoal, and eggs.

Nerrie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like vinegar, shampoo, charcoal, and eggs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 49 years old and married, with five children. Ruth works very hard to provide for them.

Ruth runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for five years and she sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, snack food, school supplies, and other supplies. 

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 52 years old and married with seven children.  With two children in school, Ofelia works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a business buying and selling gasoline in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Ofelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish and food-vending and raising pigs. Rowena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is 50 years old and married, with ten children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Welma is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Welma has been farming rice for nine years and also earns additional income from food-vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: will use the money to buy more lappa (West African garment to sell.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 58 years old, married, and has six children.

Melba is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melba has been raising pigs for ten years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coal to increase her business.

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Ade runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks, mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ade is married and living with five people in the family home. 

Ade began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business runs, Ade hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends. 

In the photo, Ade is standing in front of his small stall.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits sales on weekends.

loans.name: Ahmadu Alhaji

texts.en: Ahmadu Alhaji remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Ahmadu Alhaji, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ahmadu Alhaji  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Ahmadu Alhaji   With this loan, Ahmadu Alhaji is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 50 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador quien se dedica al mantenimiento de un rancho cercano a su localidad. Él desea hacer un cuarto para cocina ya que actualmente no tiene como se observa en la fotografía por lo que esta solicitando a FUSAI un crédito para comprar los siguientes materiales: ladrillo, cemento, arena, piedra y para el techo comprará lámina galvanizada, polines y pagará mano de obra para la construcción del cuarto para la cocina.
texts.en:
Daniel is 50 years old and he is very hard-working. His work involves maintaining a ranch close to his locality. He wishes to build a kitchen room since he currently does not have one, as observed in the photograph. 

He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase the following supplies: bricks, cement, sand, stones and for the roof he will purchase galvanized sheets, idlers and he will pay workers to build the kitchen room.

loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, sand and stone; and for the roof, to purchase galvanized sheets and idlers; and to pay workers to build the kitchen room.

loans.name: Emmanuel Sarki

texts.en: Emmanuel Sarki is a 40-year-old farmer from Sarki Kuya.  As a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel Sarki is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Emmanuel Sarki can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Emmanuel Sarki is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Dauda,Yusuf, and Alsa. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew  is a 22-year-old farmer from Sarki Galadima.  As a Babban Gona member, Andrew is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Andrew  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Andrew is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children. My overall goal is to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Krissia Evelyn

texts.es: Krissia de 23 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con la venta de productos por catalogo, la venta la hace de forma domiciliar, además vende cosméticos de forma ambulante para tener un ingreso extra. Krissia desea construir un cuarto en su propiedad ya que actualmente su casa es de lámina como se observa en la fotografía por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro además deberá pagar mano de obra para la construcción de un cuarto en su propiedad.
texts.en:
Krissia is 23 years old and she lives with her life partner and her daughter. She is an entrepreneur who earns a living selling products by catalogue. She sells through household visits and she also sells cosmetic products as a street vendor to earn extra income. 

Krissia wishes to build a room in her property since her house is currently made of metal sheet, as observed in the photograph. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron, as well as to pay workers to build the room in her property.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron; she will also pay workers to build a room in her property.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a single man. He describes himself as successful. He operates a retail business in which he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a marketable area. 

Moses will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to have a bigger clothing shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jeanete

texts.en:
Jeanete is a 48-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Jeanete has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her mat-weaving. She has been in this business for ten years. 

In the future, Jeanete would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat-weaving.

loans.name: Lally

texts.en:
Lally is 53 years old and single. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lally has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her mat-weaving. Lally has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Lally would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her mat-weaving.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 57-year-old married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emma has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. 

Emma has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her mat-weaving. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her mat-weaving.

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop where he sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He is married and lives with his wife in the family home. His wife is a full-time housewife. 

Herman joined Ruma two years ago because he wanted to increase his income. Herman sees that working with Ruma has given him a valuable opportunity to learn more about mobile technology; that makes his business more efficient. 

As the business continues, Herman hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit sales on weekends.

loans.name: Samsul Bahri

texts.en:
Samsul Bahri runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credit. He is married and living with three people in the family home in Jakarta. His wife helps him manage his small shop. 

Samsul Bahri joined Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business continues, Samsul Bahri hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on weekends. 

In the photo, Samsul Bahri is standing in his small stall.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on weekends.

loans.name: Vitória

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga Província de Inhambane, tem 28 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 4 filhos menores de idade apenas 2 é que frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha nas bananas a mais de 5 anos aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na sua obra. Com o empréstimo solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento e outro. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra e iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos para a venda.
texts.en:
Vitoria was born in Massinga, in the Inhambane province of Mozambique. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and four young children, 2 of whom are in school. She doesn't provide for anyone else besides her family. 

For more than five years she's worked on a banana farm, earning money that she uses to cover household expenses and also for a home construction project. With this loan she would like to continue with this project by buying sand, cement, and other materials. This is her third loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, she would like to finish the construction and start a business raising chickens for sale.

loans.use: continue with a construction project by buying sand, cement, and other materials.

loans.name: Maxim

texts.ru:
Максим занимается тепличным хозяйством.  Он уже ранее брал кредит в КИВА. За это время Максим увеличил доход почти в два раза и сделал отопление в теплицах.

Максим переживал за свой бизнес в этом году из-за состояния в стране. Но у них в семье все благополучно. Максим посадил по краю теплицы огурцы в начале сезона, но они все пропали. Он потерял немного дохода. 

Максим просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на постройку новой теплицы. У него есть свободный участок земли, но не хватает своих средств. Новая теплица уже осенью начнет приносить прибыль.
texts.en: Maxim farms in greenhouses. He has already received one loan from Kiva. Since the loan Maxim was able to double his profits and install heating in the greenhouses. Maxim has been worried about his business due to the unstable situation in his country. However, everything in his family is safe. Maxim planted some cucumbers at the edge of the greenhouse this season but they were all lost and so he lost some of his profits. He is now asking for a loan of 40,000 griven to build a new greenhouse. He has a free plot of land, but insufficient funds to finance the expansion. The new greenhouse will be able to bring profits as soon as this fall.

loans.use: to add one more greenhouse

loans.name: Abudo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 27 anos de idade é casada oficialmente, Responsabiliza-se pelos seus irmãos que vivem na casa dos seus pais.
Trabalha na educação como docente a mais de 5 anos aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na sua obra. Com este empréstimo pretende iniciar a construção da sua obra adquirindo material de construção como: blocos, varões, areia, pedra e cimento. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra e abrir um negócio de criação de frangos para venda. O seu maior desafio é garantir o ensino da sua esposa e dos seus irmãos até ao nível superior
texts.en:
Abudo was born in Namaacha, in the Maputo province of Mozambique. He is 27 years old and is married. He also helps care for his siblings who still live with their parents.

Abudo has worked as a teacher for more than five years, earning money that he uses to cover household expenses and also for a home construction project. With this loan he would like to begin construction by buying materials like blocks, poles, sand, stone and cement. This is his second loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, he would like to finish the construction project and start a business raising chickens for sale. His greatest challenge is to see that his wife and his siblings are able to study through college.

loans.use: begin a construction project by buying materials like blocks, poles, sand, stone and cement.

loans.name: Mykhailo

texts.ru:
Михаил женат. У него есть дочь. Михаил работает на консервном заводе уже 9 лет. Он  молодой и энергичный. Михаил заботится о своей семье. Он имеет хороший и стабильный доход, который даст ему возможность выплачивать кредит. 

Михаил просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на ремонт дома. Он хочет сделать ремонт в двух комнатах, поставить лестницу и сделать фасад дома.  Кредит поможет улучшить жилищные условия семьи.
texts.en: Mykhailo is married and has a daughter. He has worked at the canning plant for 9 years. He is young and energetic. Mykhailo cares deeply about his family. He has a good and stable income that will allow him to pay back this loan. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 griven to repair his house. He wants to improve two rooms, install a stairwell and renovate the house exterior. This loan will help him improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to remodel his house and improve living conditions

loans.name: Petro

texts.ru:
Петр женат. У него двое взрослых сыновей, которые живут отдельно. Петр работает заведующим по хозяйсту в местной школе.  А также он любит рыбалку. 

Ранее Петр служил в Афганистане и это было самым трудным в его жизни. Он любит справедливость по отношению к себе и к другим.

Петр просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 10 000 гривен на ремонт крыши  в доме. В будущем хочет сделать ремонт и внутри дома тоже.
texts.en: Petro is married. He has to adult sons who live separately. Petro is a facilities manager at the local school. He is also an enthusiastic fisherman. In the past Petro was station in Afghanistan and it was the hardest time in his life. He loves fairness to himself and others. Petro is requesting a loan of 10,000 griven to repair his roof. In the future he hopes to also fix the inside of his house.

loans.use: to fix roof at his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more paraffin for resale

loans.name: Panchita

texts.en:
Panchita is 57 years old and married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Panchita has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. Panchita requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her mat-weaving.

Panchita has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, Panchita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her mat-weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sound equipment for events such as a mixing station and speakers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baking ingredients such as flour, butter, and oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей не женат. Он работает в строительной компании монтажником гипсокартонных конструкций. Андрей молодой, скромный и трудолюбивый парень.

Андрей имел проблемы с законом. Он получил условное заключение за хулиганство. Но сейчас он изменился. Андрей получил профессию и собирается женится.

Андрей просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 12 000 гривен на ремонт квартиры. Он получил в наследство однокомнотную квартиру в плохом состоянии.  Андрей хочет сделать ремонт в спальне и ванной.
texts.en: Andrei is single. He works for a construction company as a drywall installer. Andrei is a young, humble and hardworking guy. He had problems with the law in the past and got a suspended sentence for vandalism. But he has changed - he has a stable job and wants to get married. Andrei is asking to get a loan of 12,000 griven to fix his apartment. He inherited this apartment and it's in a terrible state. He wants to repair the bedroom and bathroom first.

loans.use: to fix apartment that he inherited

loans.name: Adriano

texts.pt:
O senhor Adriano Nasceu em Chibuto Província de Gaza tem 62 anos de idade é casado oficialmente, pai de 7 filhos maiores de idade todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus netos que vivem em sua casa.
É reformado na Educação, aufere mensalmente um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com este empréstimo pretende erguer capoeiras para a criação de frangos adquirindo material de construção como areia, cimento, blocos e pedrinhas. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende concluir as suas obras e garantir a formação dos seus filhos e netos.
texts.en:
Adriano was born in Chibuto, in the Gaza province of Mozambique. He is 62 years old and is married with seven older children, all of whom are in school. He also helps care for his grandchildren who live with him.

Adriano is a retired educator and he receives a monthly pension that he uses to cover household expenses. With this loan he would like to build coops to raise chickens by buying materials like blocks, sand, cement and small stones. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, he would like to finish the construction project and see that his children and grandchildren are able to finish their schooling.

loans.use: build coops for raising chickens by buying materials like blocks, sand, cement and small stones.

loans.name: Sabzinamo

texts.ru:
Сабзинамо жительница города Куляб, Хатлонской области. Она замужем. Ей 39 лет. Сабзинамо проживает одна с детьми, так как ее муж находится на заработках за рубежом. В семье их шестеро. Сабзинамо вместе с дочерью занимается шитьем у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности она занимается на протяжении двух лет. Сабзинамо научилась шить у своей снохи. 
Сабзинамо берет кредит для приобретения модернизированной швейной машинки, которая предназначена специально для вышивки.
texts.en: Sabzinamo is a resident of Kulob in Hatlon region. She is 39 years old, married and lives alone with her six children, as he husband is away as a migrant worker. Sabzinamo and her daughters run a sewing studio from home, which was started two years ago. Sabzinamo learned to sew from her mother-in-law. She would like to take out a loan to purchase a programmable embroidery machine for her studio.

loans.use: to purcahse an embroidery machine so that she can embroider Tajik dresses

loans.name: Kiki

texts.en:
Kiki is married and living with her husband in Sukabumi, a small city in West Java. Kiki's husband works as a paddy farmer, while Kiki herself works in the rice mills. Together, they manage a small shop that sells mobile phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits to increase their income. 

Kiki began working with Ruma a month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. Kiki is also excited to learn about mobile technology. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends. Furthermore, Kiki wants to explore more business opportunities. 

In the photo, Kiki is standing with her husband in their small shop.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit sales on weekends.

loans.name: David Dio

texts.en: David Dio is a 40-year-old farmer from Sarki Galadima.  As a Babban Gona member, David Dio, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, David Dio can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 35 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, David Dio is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  David Dio is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Jonathan,  and  Enuch. David Dio’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Ligia Raquel

texts.es: Ligia de 28 años de edad vive con su hija de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se dedica a la venta de pollos en el mercado central de su municipio, su esposo trabaja como motorista de buses internacionales lo que le permite apoyarla en la economía del hogar. Ligia desea encementar el piso de su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía actualmente es de tierra lo que provoca insalubridad para su hija por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar arena, grava y cemento, además deberá pagar mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ligia is 28 years old and she lives with her 3 year old daughter. She is a tenacious woman who sells poultry at the central market in her municipality. Her husband works as a bus driver for international bus travels; this allows him to support home expenses. 

Ligia wishes to lay concrete in her household floor since currently it is dirt, as observed in the photograph; this results in unsafe conditions for her daughter. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase sand, gravel and cement, she will also have to pay workers to lay concrete in the floor of her household.

loans.use: to purchase sand, gravel and cement, as well as to pay workers to lay cement in the floor of her household.

loans.name: Nicolas Alberto

texts.es: Nicolas es originario de Nueva Guinea, se dedica a la mecánica en un taller de un tío cercano, su esposa labora para el sector publico, ambos son personas responsables y muy esforzados, no tienen hijos aun, solicita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para realizar un anexo en vivienda que tiene en proceso y que aun no presta las condiciones para habitar por lo tanto necesita acondicionar un local donde habitara provisionalmente con su esposa pues actualmente viven donde un familiar, don Nicolas ha ido construyendo poco a poco parte por parte con ayuda de su esposa su vivienda y su mayor propósito a futuro es terminar su vivienda para contar con un hogar digno y esperar a sus hijos en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Nicolas is from New Guinea.  He works as a mechanic at a nearby uncle’s shop.  His wife works for the public sector.  Both of them are responsible people, and they are very earnest.  They do not yet have children.

He is requesting this loan to buy construction materials in order to build an annex onto his house that is being built.  It is not yet ready to inhabit.  That is why he very much needs to prepare a place to live provisionally with his wife.  They currently live with a relative.

Nicolas has been building his house little by little, part by part, with help from his wife.  His biggest ambition for the future is to finish his house in order to have a decent home and to await his children in good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Kiswaritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KISWARITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho   integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de llamadas, taller de costura, venta de calzado de damas, servicio de internet, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una campaña de promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de colchas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre quien tiene el mismo negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de colchas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y vive con su madre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Kiswaritas community bank is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer through Panamericana regional hub. It comprises eight members and is run by a Board of Directors of which Lourdes is the President. The businesses run by the members of this communal bank are diverse. They include a call center, a sewing shop, an Internet cafe, selling women's shoes, selling food, and selling vegetables.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small entrepreneurs in Lourdes' group. She says she joined Pro Mujer two years ago through an invitation from one of their promotion campaigns. She currently has a business selling bedspreads. She says she started this business several years ago and learned it from her mother, who runs the same kind of business.
 
The loan she is now requesting is to increase capital by purchasing wholesale bedspreads, which she will buy from wholesale retailers in the city of Oruro. She will then sell them in her shop. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and lives with her mother.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the insurance offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy wholesale bedspreads.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 37 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de 4 filhos  que frequentam a escola.
É motorista na empresa Tirona a 1 ano, aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na sua obra de residência. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir material de construção como areia, cimento cola e tijoleiras para finalizar a sua obra. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende casar e abrir um estaleiro para a venda de material de construção.
texts.en:
Manuel was born in Namaacha, in the Maputo province of Mozambique. He is 37 years old and lives with his common-law wife and their four children, all of whom are in school. 

Manuel has worked as a driver for the Tirona company for one year, earning money that he uses to cover household expenses and also for a home construction project. With this loan he would like to buy construction materials like sand, adhesive cement and large bricks. This is his sixth loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, he would like to get married officially and open a site from which he can sell construction materials.

loans.use: buy construction materials like sand, adhesive cement and large bricks to finish his building project.

loans.name: Eckrine

texts.en: Eckrine is a married woman. She describes herself as self committed. She operates a tailoring business, where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a local area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana works hard to support her family. Feliciana is married and has a buy-and-sell scrap materials business in the Philippines.

Feliciana requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Feliciana has been in this business for 5 years now.

Feliciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Risalie

texts.en:
Risalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shell craft business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase shells to make shell craft for her shell craft business.

Risalie has been in this business for five years. Risalie earns additional income from buying and selling rice and charcoal and from raising pigs.

Risalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shell to make shell craft

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 50 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Maria Fe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Fe requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Fe has been raising pigs for twenty years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fidelina De Jesús

texts.es:
Fidelina de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta el bachillerato, su madre no pudo darle sus estudios universitarios. Esta casada, su esposo trabaja como motorista en un bus, actualmente no tienen hijos su hogar esta conformado por ellos dos.

Fidelina tiene 6 meses de haber iniciado su empleo como encargada de la unidad de mujer en la alcaldía de su pueblo, se encarga de gestionar proyectos para beneficio de la mujer de su pueblo,  su hora de entrada es de 8:00 A.M a 4: 00 P.M la distancia que tiene que moverse a su trabajo es poca como a 10 minutos a pie de su casa.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar un terreno,   para  después construir su casa, para puando nazcan sus hijos puedan tener su casa propia.
 
	
Los sueños de Fidelina es trabajar mucho y ahorrar para estudiar en la universidad y graduarse como psicóloga.
texts.en:
23-year old Fidelina graduated from high school but her mother could not afford to support her through university. She is married; her husband works as a bus driver. They don't have children, so there are just the two of them.

Six months ago Fidelina started her job as the person responsible for the women's programs run out of city hall. She organizes projects that will benefit local women. Her hours of work are 8am to 4pm. She walks to work in about ten minutes as it is a short distance from her home.

Fidelina is seeking a loan from CrediCampo to buy land where she can later build a house so that when she has children, the family will have a house of its own. Her dream is to work hard, save money, and one day attend university and graduate as a psychologist.

loans.use: buy land on which to build a house for her future family

loans.name: Sohibjon

texts.ru: Сохибчон мужчина в возрасте 39 лет, женат и имеет 3 детей. Сохибчон родился и вырос в сельской местности. Отец Сохибчона занимался земледелием и Сохибчон с детства помогал отцу на поле. Он поливал, пропалывал и охранял посевы отца. Должного образования Сохибчон так и не смог получить так, как на учебу не было возможности у его родителей. Как говорит сам Сохибчон «Я в детстве очень любил автомобили и в тайне от отца помогал мастеру ремонтировать автомобили и он меня научил этой профессии». Когда Сохибчон  вырос то он решил открыть авто-мастерскую и начать свое дело. Но не имея финансов он был вынужден поехать в Россию на заработки. Заработав там начальный капитал он все таки открыл свое дело.Начал ремонтировать машины. На данный момент это дело является основным источником дохода для его семьи. Сохибчон хочет обеспечить свою семью и дать детям возможность получить образование. Сейчас Сохибчон хочет расширить свое дело и купить автозапчасти. Ему нужны финансы для осуществления его планов. Сохибчон обратился в «Арванд»  за помощью.  Сохибчон выражает благодарность таким организациям как ООО МДО «Арванд» за финансовую поддержку сельских жителей.
texts.en: Sohibjon is 39 years old, married and has three children. Sohibjon was born in a rural area, to a peasant family and helped his father grow crops since childhood. He watered, weeded and guarded the family fields. Sohibjon never received a proper education as his parents couldn't afford it. This is Sohibjon own words: "I loved cars since childhood and helped the local mechanic repair automobiles in secret from my father. I learned my trade from this man". When Sohibjon became an adult, he decided to open his own automotive repair shop. However, he had no savings, so decided to travel to Russia as a migrant worker to save up money. Once he had earned enough capital to start, he finally opened his shop and started fixing cars. This is now the main source of income for his family. Sohibjon wants to provide well for his family and assure his own children will get a good education. Sohibjon wants to expand his shop and purchase spare parts. For this he needs financial assistance, so he has turned to "Arvand" for a loan. Sohibjon is very grateful to "Arvand" for the financial help they provide to rural residents.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Nuhu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Mahamiya, Ileshe, and  Kekira. Nuhu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Nuhu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Nuhu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to build a better home.” Nuhu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Reni

texts.en:
Reni runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Reni lives in Cianjur, a small city in West Java. She is married and living with five people in the family home. Her husband is a private worker, and her three children are going to school. 

Reni began working with Ruma a month ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits, and she believes using mobile technology will help her do it more easily. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the future, Reni plans to seek more business opportunities. 

In the photo, Reni is sitting in her small stall.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit sales on weekends.

loans.name: Maria Digna

texts.es: Digna de 47 años de edad vive con sus tres hijos de 12, 19 y 25 años de edad, además vive con ellos un nieto de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo productos de belleza de diferentes catálogos desde hace 3 años, su hija también aporta a la economía familiar. Digna desea construir un baño ya que actualmente no cuentan con uno, además necesita encementar el patio y cambiar el techo de su vivienda para lo que   solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina, cemento, arena, grava, piedra y polines para poder llevar a cabo estas mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Digna, 47 years of age, lives with her three children who are 12, 19, and 25 years of age. A 4-year old grandson also lives with them.

She is an enterprising woman who has made her living selling beauty products from different catalogs for 3 years. Her daughter also helps with family expenses.

Digna wishes to build a bathroom, since they don't currently have one. She also needs to cement the patio and to replace the roof of her house. This is why she is applying to FUSAI for a loan in order to buy metal sheets, cement, sand, gravel, stones, and beams so that she can make these improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, sand, gravel, stones, and beams to build a bathroom, replace the roof, and cement the patio floor of her house.

loans.name: Hector Sebastian

texts.es:
El señor Héctor  de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa tiene  casa propia e sus  hijos  que  dependen de el, vive en una comunidad  al Oriente de Honduras.
Don Héctor se dedica desde hace 8 años a la compra y venta de granos básicos, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz y frijoles y así brindar mejor atención a sus clientes, también espera que esta inversión le permita generar los ingresos necesarios para poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Don Héctor su sueño es ver profesionales a sus hijos.

 Trojes, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Héctor, 36 years of age, lives with his wife. He has his own house and children who depend on him. He lives in a community in eastern Honduras.

For 8 years, Héctor has made his living buying and selling dry beans and grains. He is applying for the loan to buy corn and beans so that he can provide better service to his customers. He also hopes that this investment will allow him to generate the necessary income to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Héctor's dream is to see his children become professionals.

Trojes, Honduras - June 2014

loans.use: to buy corn and beans for his business.

loans.name: Agaissa

texts.pt:
Nasceu em namaacha província de Maputo tem 24 anos de idade, solteiro, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
