She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more poultry. Her business goal is to have a big farm and be a supplier within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans have been repaid  successfully.

loans.use: buy more poultry

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Catherine is 42 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Catherine has a food vending business in the Philippines. Catherine requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Catherine has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 32 years old and married with five children.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads, cereals, milk, snack foods, etc. to sell.

Lucia has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lucia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads, cereals, milk, snack foods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nurkabool

texts.ru:
Нуркабул добродушный и жизнерадостный парень в возрасте 26 лет. Он пока ещё не женат, но вскоре собирается. Поэтому пока всю свою душу он вкладывает в свою работу. Нуркабул живёт со своими родителями в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он занимается своим бизнесом. 

Нуркабул занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Нуркабул занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его родители и младшие братья помогают ему ухаживать и растить скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Нуркабул хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Нуркабул заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку и очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Nurkabool is a kind and happy 26-year-old young man. He is not yet married, but planning to soon. This is why he is investing all of his soul into his work. Nurkabool lives with his parents in a small house in a rural village. He is involved in his own business in order to support his family.

Nurkabool is involved in farming and animal husbandry. He has a land plot, part of which is rainfed and part is irrigated land. Nurkabool grows carrots, potatoes and cereal crops in this land. His parents and younger brothers help him to care for and raise livestock. Because their land plot is large, they also use it for livestock pasture. The animal husbandry business yields a good income, and this is why Nurkabool wants to expand this business by increasing livestock headcount. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Nurkabool thanks Arvand in advance for the financial assistance and hopes very much for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dishes (tubs, buckets, pans) to sell

loans.name: Maricho

texts.en:
Maricho is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricho is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maricho has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Maricho requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.

Maricho has been in this business for 9 years. In the future Maricho would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Yuyun

texts.en:
Yuyun and her husband live in West Bandung, a regency in West Java near Bandung City. Yuyun runs a small stall that sells consumer goods (snacks, drinks, personal and home care products) and mobile phone airtime credit. 

She began working with Ruma a month ago because she was interested to increase her income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends. 

In the photo, Yuyun is standing inside her small stall.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit sales on weekends.

loans.name: Tersolita

texts.en:
Tersolita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Tersolita is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Tersolita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Tersolita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Tersolita has been in this business for 5 years. Tersolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Germania Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Del Futuro, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.
En este lugar vive la señora Germania, tiene 45 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. 
Doña Germania es  una gran mujer que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres  días a la semana de dos a tres  horas al día y en los momentos que está desocupada, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana su sustento diario.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva más de 3 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the Las Orquideas section of the city of Portoviejo, Grupo de Credito Mujeres del Futuro meets every fifteen days.  This is a marginal urban zone where people engage in diverse activities.
Germania lives in this place.  She is 45 years old.  Several years ago her beloved husband passed away.  From this union, she has four children of majority age, two of whom still live at home.
Germania is a great lady who, in order to obtain her own resources and with these forge ahead, makes a living from the sale of lingerie and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  Her sales technique is to go door-to-door and she works three days a week for two or three hours.  When she is not working this way, she makes her products available on credit and collects every week.  For over three years, she has been making a living like this with which she has been able to satisfy her daily needs. 
This loan is needed to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and lingerie.  She has been in the Grupo de Credito for more than three years and she likes it because with one the loans she was able to initiate her business.  Her dreams are to continue moving ahead.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and lingerie.

loans.name: Merida Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Del Futuro, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.
En este lugar vive la señora Mérida, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es chofer. 
Doña Merida es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, edredones, toallas entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja de dos a tres horas al día ya que es un trabajo que no tiene horario fijo, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, sus ventas las realiza muy rápido ya que cuenta con buena clientela.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, ropa y toallas. Este es su quinto ciclo en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en: In the Las Orquideas neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo, the "Mujeres del Futuro" credit group meets every two weeks.  This is an area on the outskirts of the city where people work at a variety of activities.  Merida lives here.  She is 34 years old and married, and has two children from this marriage who are 12 and 10 and are in school.  Her husband is a driver.  Merida is a stay-at-home parent who works selling all kinds of clothing, sheets, duvets and towels, among other things, in order to help her husband to provide for their household.  She sells door-to-door, and works two or three hours a day at times that are not fixed. She provides her products on credit, and collects payments for them every week.  She began this business 6 years ago, and it is going very well for her.  She makes her sales very quickly and has good customers.  This loan is to buy sheets, clothing and towels.  This is her fifth loan cycle with the credit group, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy sheets, clothing, and towels.

loans.name: Genelinda

texts.en:
Genelinda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Genelinda is 32 years old, and her three children are all in school.

Genelinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Genelinda requested a PHP 15,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net and gasoline for her business.

Genelinda has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Genelinda would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 15,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Josephine has been in this business for 20 years.

Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Evangeline has been in this business for 22 years now.

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Vivian works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Vivian is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Yryskan

texts.ru: Ырыскан 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Ырыскан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, благодаря упорному труду Ырыскан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 4 овцы, а также на собственных 0,50 ГА она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Супруг  и младшие дети активно помогает по хозяйству. Накопленные средства стараются вкладывать в развитие и расширение бизнеса, а также в улучшение жилищных условий. Ырыскан уже залила фундамент будущего просторного дома для нее и ее семьи, однако еще нужны средства на покупку кирпича, шифера и прочих строительных материалов. В целях завершения строительства дома, Ырыскан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сомов (KGS). Доходы от бизнеса Ырыскан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие животноводческой деятельности, так как она хочет еще построить дом для сына.
texts.en: Yryskan is 50 years old, married and raising 5 children together with her husband. Yryskan has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry. Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 6 cows, 4 sheep, and also 0.50 hectares of owned land, where she grows corn. The monthly income is approximately 15,000 som (KGS). Her husband and younger children actively help her with the business. They try to invest their savings into developing and expanding the business, and also into improving their living conditions. Yryskan already filled the foundation of their future, spacious house with cement, but still needs money to buy bricks, slates and other construction materials. In order to complete the construction of the house for herself and her family, Yryskan requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank. Yryskan plans to invest the earnings from her business into further developing her animal husbandry activity because she wants to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy bricks, slates and other construction materials in order to finish building her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: by buying more goods to sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 55 years old and married with five children. She lives in a rural area of the Memot district of Kampong Cham. She has been farming rice and growing cassava and she supplements the family’s income by raising cows and working for others for a fee. With the current business, she can earn about US$16 per day to meet her family’s needs.

Sok is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s school fee. She hopes to keep her son in school until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay her son’s school fee.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
La socia Lizbeth pertenece al banco comunal “Todos Unidos”, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio  de venta de auto partes, la socia vende diferentes accesorio como retrovisores, bujías entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socias solicito el crédito para la compra de faros entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Lizbeth belongs to the "Todos Unidos" communal bank.  She continues to work at her business selling auto parts.  She sells different accessories such as rear-view mirrors and spark plugs, among other things, to customers who order them from her.  She is a very responsible and determined person, as this is the way that she is supporting her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy headlights and other items for her business.  She feels grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy headlights and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his brother's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and leather.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Del Futuro, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es mecánico. 
Doña Rosa con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa, ropa interior, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, ella sale tres días a la semana más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más de 10 años en su negocio con el cual ayuda a su familia a salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa,  perfumes, zapatos y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de  Crédito y le gusta porque así mejora su negocio. Sus sueños seguir mejorando su negocio cada vez más.
texts.en:
In the Las Orquideas section of the city of Portoviejo, Grupo de Credito Mujeres del Futuro meets every fifteen days.  This is a marginal urban zone where the people make a living engaging in various activities.
Rosa lives in this place.  She is 54 years old and married.  From this union, she has four children of the age of majority and independent.  Her husband is a mechanic.
For the purpose of having her own income, Rosa makes a living selling clothing, lingerie, shoes, cosmetics and other things.  Her sales method is to go door-to-door or at her house where her customers come.  She usually goes out three days a week in the morning since during this time it is easier for her to make her rounds.  She sells on credit and collects every eight days.  She has been in this business for over ten years which has helped her family get ahead.
She will use this loan to buy clothing, perfumes, shoes, and cosmetics.  She has been with the Grupo de Credito since the beginning and she likes it because in this way she improves her business.  Her dreams are to continue improving her business even more.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es:
Blanca es una gran vendedora de mercancía básicamente ropa para hombre y dama ya que debía generar recursos para ayudar a su esposo a mantener un hogar formado por 5 hijos eran muchos bocas que alimentar y desde entonces se trazó la meta de ser la mejor para darle lo mejor a sus hijos que hoy en día son todos mayores de edad por lo que las ganancias le ayudan para mantener el hogar y realizar reformas para hacerlo ver más lindo.
Solicita un crédito para surtirse de mejor mercancía pues la fuerte competencia del sector amenaza sus ventas lo que le preocupa mucho pues ya por su edad no tiene como conseguir empleo en alguna fabrica para generar recursos para comer.
texts.en:
Blanca is a great saleswoman, selling men’s and women’s clothing. She needed to generate resources in order to help her husband provide for their home in which there were many mouths to feed, as they have five children; and since then, she has set the goal of being the best, in order to give the best to her children.  They are grown up now, so her earnings help her to maintain and refurbish the house in order to make it look prettier.

She is seeking a loan in order to supply herself with better merchandise, as the strong competition in her sector is threatening her sales. This worries her, as at her age she cannot get work in a factory in order to put food on the table.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in order to improve her sales.

loans.name: Thekrayat Al- Thawra Group

texts.en:
Thekrayat Al- Thawra is a group which is comprised of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.


Hayat is the leader of the group. She is a 28-year-old married woman with only one child. Her child is six years old. She studied till the secondary education, but she couldn't complete her study. 

She has a small shop in her area but the income from it is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Hayat's house lacks many food materials. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 to purchase the necessary food materials in order to meet all the demands of the family.  

Hayat looks forward to taking another loan to increase the capital of her small shop. She also hopes to save all food materials for her house in order to make delicious food for her family.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary food materials in order to meet all the demands of the family.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 68 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Loida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Loida has been in pig fattening for 12 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like pants, shoes, sandals, blouses, etc., to sell to her customers.

Generosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like pants, shoes, sandals, blouses, etc., to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Emma

texts.en:
Ma. Emma is 48 years old, married, and has nine children, three children of whom are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Emma has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Ma. Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlene is 43 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Arlene has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like bamboo for her business.

Arlene has been in this business for 8 years. In the future Arlene would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like bamboo for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats in order to raise and sell them in the local markets

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
Sreymao is aged 33 years and married with three children, who are still in school. She lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Bovel district. She and her husband earn a living through planting rice and beans. They have been in this business for fourteen years. The current business earns them about 53,000 KHR per day. 

Sreymao’s group consists of four female members. She is a tenth-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy school materials for her children’s education and use a portion of it to buy household supplies. She hopes to keep her children in school and to have enough supplies for using in her family.

loans.use: to buy school materials for her children’s education.

loans.name: Al-Kasab Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Kasab. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Amina is the leader of the group. She is a 56-year-old married woman with eight children living with her family in Hodeidah City, Yemen. Her oldest child is 35 years old and the youngest one is 12 years old. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very active and dynamic. Amina did not surrender to her miserable conditions but decided to work selling mobile phones in the streets. She has worked in this humble business for more than two years. For further expanding, Amina asked for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more mobile phones for resale to customers in the streets.

Amina looks forward to expanding her business more through opening a shop to sell all home appliances, such as refrigerators, televisions, irons and other home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones for resale to customers in the streets.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000.  This loan is intended for food vending purposes.

Teresita dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for vending

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Ailyn has been in this business for 15 years. Ailyn earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 50 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Chita has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from fishing.

Chita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Egina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Egina works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Egina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Egina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Rosalinda has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Gingle

texts.en:
Gingle is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gingle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Gingle has been in pig fattening for 14 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as powder, soap, toothpaste, tissue etc.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Phnom Prek district, Sokha is a 35-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are still in school. She and her husband have earned a living through growing corn for ten years. To better support the family, her husband works as a construction worker. 

This is group loan for Sokha with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to spend on school materials for her children. She hopes to support her children’s education in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy school materials for her children.

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en:
Elesia is 47 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elesia is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other supplies for her business.

Elesia has been farming rice for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 47 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rosana is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosana has been in pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with four children. For the past four years, she has operated a bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines. Jocelyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Jocelyn is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her bamboo-weaving business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her bamboo-weaving business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old and married with seven children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Gloria aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 56 years old and married with four children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from selling food. Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF.  

Rosemarie is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase prodcuts to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is an example of an ambitious and successful young Yemeni man. In spite of the prevailing depression and frustration in the country, he is able to build his own future.

Bassam is 29 years old single man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He holds a bachelor's degree in pharmacy. Because Bassam has great belief in himself and his abilities, he was able to get a job in a pharmacy. Getting a job was a very important stage in his life since it enabled him to get experience and accumulate some money. 

Unlike most of his peers, he wasn’t thinking of getting married and building a family in the time being. He was focused in starting up his own business and securing his future. After working for some years in a pharmacy, two months ago he opened  his own pharmacy. Although opening a pharmacy can mean large profits, it takes a relatively large investment to get off the ground, especially in Yemen where there are many pharmacies in the city, and to meet the demand of customers, most if not all medicines should be available. 

Unfortunately Bassam doesn’t have the required capital to do that, so he applied for a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to purchase medicines. Bassam is sure that this loan will help him a lot and assist him to go on in his business. Bassam looks forwards to expanding his business and opening more branches in different locations in the city.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for the pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. She has run her business for the past six years and earns additional income from operating a general store. Valentina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Valentina is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 44-year-old married man and a father of four children, living with them in Haja, Yemen. He has a university education, but he couldn't find a job in order to look after his family. 

Khaled works as a driver for one of his friend's motorcycles with a low salary. That salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of his family. He tried to seek another business in order to improve the living standards of his family. The high rates of the unemployment in the country is a real problem for many people and youths who have certificates. 

As a result, Khaled decided to purchase a motorcycle to transport people in order to get money to improve the living standards of his family. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase his own motorcycle to transport people.

Khaled looks forward to purchasing a minibus that will help him to improve the living standards of his family.  He is awaiting your support.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle  to transport people.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Phnom Prek district, Phat is aged 40 years and married with four children. To make a living and support her family, Phat and her husband have been farming rice and growing corn as primary businesses for nine years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first microloan for Phat with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy rice seeds and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 44 years old and married. She works hard to help her husband.

Nelly has a seaweed-culturing business in the Philippines. Nelly has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, plastic rope and pay for the laborers' salaries.

Nelly has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedling, plastic rope and pay for the laborers salaries

loans.name: Anome

texts.en:
Anome is 77 years old and married with fourteen children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, seasonings, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc., to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 31 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from fish and food vending.

Anome aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, seasonings, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc., to sell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris: Es una señora alegre, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 39 años de edad. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace más de 15 años estableció su salón de belleza, donde ofrece todo tipo de peinados, encolochado, alisado, tinte entre otros y está ubicado en un punto estratégico. Solicita financiamiento, comprar productos: tintes, shampoo para el control de la caspa, para la caída del cabello, maquillaje, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tomar un curso de actualización de belleza. 

En la fotografia se muestra el trabajo que realizan a diario con uno de los ayudantes estilistas.
texts.en:
Damaris, age 39, is a cheerful woman who is originally from Puerto Cabezas. With the goal of having her own source of income, she started a beauty salon more than 15 years ago. She offers all types of haircuts, perms, straightening, coloring, and other services. Her business is situated in a strategic location.

Damaris is requesting a loan in order to buy products such as dyes, dandruff control shampoo, anti-balding shampoo, makeup, and other items. Her dream is to take a refresher beauty course. The borrower is pictured with one of her stylist assistants.

loans.use: to buy dyes, dandruff control shampoo, anti-balding shampoo, makeup, and other items.

loans.name: Sinang

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province, Sineang is 56 years old and married.  She meets the needs in her household via rice farming.  

Currently, she needs to support her child who is in university.  Since the tuition fee has become a burden for her, she decided to get an education loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

The entire loan will cover the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree, majoring in Information Technology. She hopes that her son can pay more attention to his study and get a good degree.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fee for her son

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Welsonia

texts.en:
Welsonia is 44 years old and married with five children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years, she has been raising livestock in the Philippines. Welsonia has borrowed 15 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Welsonia is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, feed, and other supplies

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Bovel district of Battambang province, Heang is 45 years old and married. She overcomes her family hardship via rice farming, cassava planting, and pig-raising businesses as the main source of income. 

In the same business loan group, she leads her team again to get the consumption loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy household appliances for her family. 

She hopes to gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy household appliances for her family.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el Caserío de Laynas, una comunidad rural del distrito de Morropon de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la misma Provincia que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, chicha y piqueos, cuenta con clientela considerable en la zona, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace varios años, también brinda servicios adicionales como mano de obra en la cosecha de plátanos en las chacras de sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar de construir una parte de su vivienda y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable para vivir.
texts.en:
Gladys is 43 and lives in Caserío de Laynas, a rural community in the District of Morropon (which also the name of the province), along northern coast of Peru. This region has a hot climate and many people in the area work as farmers and ranchers or run small businesses. 

Gladys has sold beer, chicha [a beverage made from corn] and Peruvian dishes for several years to a large customer base in Caserío de Laynas. She also works on banana plantations owned by her neighbors and other residents in the area. 

Gladys has applied for a loan of 4,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase building materials so she can complete construction of part of her house. Once she has finished this project, she'll have a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials so she can complete construction of part of her house.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Зилола добродушная женщина. Ей 43 года. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Она живет вместе с братом и его женой. Зилола хочет организовать свой бизнес и таким образом достичь успеха в жизни. Она планирует открыть свою аптеку. Зилола живет в кишлаке и поэтому она решила открыть аптеку, так как местные жители нуждаются в аптеке. Зилола участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки лекарства, чтобы открыть аптеку. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zilola is a kindhearted 43-year-old who is unmarried and has no children.  She lives together with her brother and his wife.  Zilola wants to open her own drugstore and become a successful entrepreneur.  To this end, she's already enrolled in a course titled "Achieve Success" sponsored by an association for businesswomen and received a certificate upon completion.  Zilola lives in a kishlak, and has decided to set up a drugstore in particular because the residents there are in need of one.  She's requesting a loan of 7500 somoni to buy an initial stock of medicine for her store, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: stock up on medicine for her new drugstore

loans.name: Hameshan Group

texts.en:
Hameshan is a group which consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 75,000 YER from AMB.

Fozia is the leader of the group. She is a 41-year-old married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 27 years old and the youngest one is 17 years old. Fozia lives with them in her own house in Sana'a. Fozia is very active and dynamic woman. Her husband is the breadwinner of the family. In order to help him in meeting the demands of the family, Fozia decided to work in tailoring. She has worked in that business for more than ten years. She makes modest profits. In reality, the money that she earns is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. As a result, Fozia applied for a loan of 15,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for her house to meet the needs of the family.

Fozia looks forward to opening a savings account in AMB. She hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her house to meet the needs of the family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Faeqa

texts.en: Faeqa was born in 1962. She lives in Salt, Jordan. She has been running her own beauty salon business for three years. Her business has been profitable for her and she is still planning to expand it more. Now she is seeking to buy more hair dryers and chairs for the customers, which might be a step to expand her business. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Sausten

texts.en:
Meet 58-year-old Sausten who likes to describe himself as a happy family man. Sausten takes care of his seven children with the help of family after the loss of his wife. All his children are currently attending school. Sausten is able to afford the school fees by operating a Zoona mobile money transfer business in his small hometown of Petauke, Zambia.

Sausten began operating his mobile money transfer shop in 2009. From the time he started, he has managed to open three additional outlets in his hometown of Petauke. He describes his business as a mobile platform that allows people in Zambia to send and receive money and pay bills safely.

Sausten enjoys his business because he has the chance to interact with a lot of people in his community. It makes him happy to provide a service that people need.

Sausten is grateful to all the Kiva lenders who are helping small business owners like himself grow their businesses. The loan will increase his cash-on-hand at his outlets so he can accommodate more customers' money transfer needs. By serving more customers, Sausten will earn more profit. He says he will continue to use his profits to grow his business and support his children in their schooling.

loans.use: to increase his cash-on-hand at his outlets so he can accommodate more customers' money transfer needs

loans.name: Delisa

texts.en:
Meet 30 year old Delisa. She has three children ages 11, 7 and 1.  She lives with her husband in Lusaka, Zambia. Delisa is requesting her third Kiva loan. The first loan Delisa received helped her to open her second mobile money outlet in Mtendere, a highly populated area in Lusaka. She then requested a second loan to help increase her capital to serve additional customers at the outlet. The profits from the business helped Delisa to rent a larger house for her family to live in comfortably.

Now Delisa is requesting a third Kiva loan so that she can increase the money that she uses to serve customers. This means that Delisa will be able to serve more customers in an efficient manner. As Delisa’s business has grown she has realized the need to have higher levels of cash-on-hand to service the additional customer demand. Delisa’s shops see a lot of customers coming and going since they are located in a busy market with lots of people. With her Kiva loan Delisa hopes to never have to turn away a potential customer because of not having enough liquidity in her business.

loans.use: To increase the money that she uses to serve customers

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en: Gorreti lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). Gorreti has a poultry farm. She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week. She sells her products from home on retail. She gets additional income from selling charcoal. She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her main business challenges  include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a demonstration farm in the future. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa was born in 1973. She is a married woman living with her husband and four sons and daughters in Irbid, Jordan. She has been trying her best to help in covering her children needs for one year by running her own mini market. Now she is seeking a loan that will help to expand it by purchasing new merchandise of food products that will raise her profit.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise of food products for her mini market

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a new customer, a resident of Ntungamo district, married with children. Her major activity is coffee farming, where she is getting little output and she wants to add more grass and cow dung which will increase yields from the plantation, increasing income for her family. 
She has applied for a loan of UGX1,500,000. She wants to use the money to improve her coffee plantation. She has a challenge of low production in her farming due to lack of consistent working capital. Her prime target is to yield high output from her plantation so that she can afford a better education for her children. With this loan she will buy organic fertilizers and believes that her production will improve and so will her yields. In turn hers and the family's standard of living will improve.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and one of them goes to school. Esther has no additional family members. For the past three years, she has operated a salon at the market and she works six days a week. Esther’s major business challenges are electricity and thieves. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but not running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

Esther is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan MCDT – SACCO to buy hair relaxers, treatments, shampoo, and braids. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her salon into a bridal shop with jewelry.

loans.use: to buy relaxers,shampoo and braids

loans.name: Ccolque T Ikari - Chocopia Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CCOLQUE TIKARI -CHOCOPIA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Colquepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly ella es viuda y tiene 44 años y tiene 3 hijos; ; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también la socia se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de ganaderia, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Ccolque T Ikari-Chocopia Communal Bank. This bank is located in the district of Colquepata, which belongs to the province of Paucartambo and the department of Cusco. 

 The member is Señora Nelly, who is 44 years old, and a widow with 3 children. She works in her business, raising and selling animals, and she also works in agriculture. She raises and fattens guinea pigs and hens, selling them later in the different markets; and it is by means of this little business that she provides for her children. The member’s dream is to have a store where she would be able to sell the guinea pigs and hens.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase guinea pigs and hens, and feed for them.
 
The other members are engaged in the business of livestock-raising, animal sales, a grocery store, and a food business. The member thanks those who form part of this dream by these means, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and hens, and feed for them.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is married with five children and all of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family. For the past six years, Gertrude has made liquid soap locally. She works in the market seven days a week and sells her soap retail. Gertrude’s major business challenges include price fluctuations to buy her materials. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and running water and her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Gertrude is requesting a 400,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy materials to make soap. Her goal and aspiration is to open a soap-making factory in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to make soap

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel Cristina tiene 32 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a las ventas de cerveza, bebidas y comidas, actividad que realiza hace más de 3 años en su domicilio, es conocida por la actividad que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina is 32 years old and lives in the district of Buenos Aires. It is a community known for agriculture, business, and raising livestock. It is located in the Province of Morropon and belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.
She makes a living selling beer, drinks and food. She has run her business from her home for 3 years. She is known for the work she does and she is asking for a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for $1,075 so she can purchase more beer that she will use to stock her business. This will help her earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: purchase beer to stock her business.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
On any given day, Terry can be found at the red shipping container filled with crates of Coca-Cola, Fanta, and Sprite located at the bustling minibus
station and market of Chipata compound, Lusaka. This is Terryʼs micro-distribution center (MDC), where he sells Coca-Cola products at wholesale to local retailers.

MDCs are a distribution model that was developed by The Coca-Cola Company’s (TCCC) bottler in Ethiopia in 1999 as an innovative way to get their products to hard-to-reach urban areas. The model relies on a network of independently owned MDCs that are run by local entrepreneurs. In Zambia, entrepreneurs must invest approximately $2,500 to purchase the container and another $3,000 to stock it full of drinks to become an MDC. Today, the MDC channel represents 47% of Coca-Colaʼs distribution channel in Zambia.

Terry is 33 years old and became an MDC in June 2009 because he did not have any job security where he was working at the time. “Employment opportunities in the country were next to zero,” Terry explains. Since that time he and his wife Thandiwe have opened another location in Chazanga, and the income from the two MDCs support them and their two young children.

Terry has requested a Kiva loan so that he can order more stock for his shipping container. This will help him increase his stock and high turnover will bring him additional profit. Terry and his wife make a good team working hard to improve their family’s standard of living and provide ample opportunity for their growing children.

loans.use: to order more stock for his shipping container.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 57, is married to George and the couple have children. She has been farming for the last seven years and earns an income of 9,200,000 KES.

Esther took out and successfully repaid two previous loans through VisionFund Kenya. She is now applying for a third loan of 15,000 KES to buy goats to raise and sell and to buy seeds and fertilizers for the new planting season. The anticipated profits will be used to pay her children’s school fees. 

She hopes to earn enough money to buy a piece of land upon which she plans to build a house for her family someday.

loans.use: to buy goats and seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Yunia

texts.en:
Yunia lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with three children and two of them go to school. She has additional family members.  She operates a retail shop at the market. She works seven days a week.  She has been in this business for three years. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, flour, rice, salt and beans. 

Yunia's major challenge includes transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt, sugar, flour and beans.

loans.name: Mufeeda

texts.en: Mufeeda is a conservative lady so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Mufeeda is a 55-year-old married lady living with her family consisting of four members in Ajloun, Jordan. Her husband is a retired man, and she has been helping him in paying their household expenses for three years by sewing clothes at her house and selling them to her neighbors and friends. Now she is seeking a loan to bring in more fabric and sewing tools so that she will be more productive and be able to respond to her customers’ requests quickly.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric and sewing tools for her business.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo y esposa en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicad en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Tiene su motokarguera la cual brinda servicio de carga y cría, también se dedica a la venta de animales de corral desde hace varios años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Estanislao is 41 years old and lives with his wife and son in the district of Oyotun. It is a community known for agriculture, business and raising livestock. It is located in the Province of Chiclayo that belongs to the reigion Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. 
He runs his business from his motorcycle and delivers animals to his customers. A few years ago he also began to sell his own animals. He is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternative of $1,075 so he can purchase more animals and be able to make more money to support his family.

loans.use: purchase more animals to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a single lady. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
María Marleny tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive junto a sus tres hijos esposo en el Distrito de La Matanza una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y crianza de animales menores, es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, es conocida en su caserío por la actividad que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera ofreceros a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Marleny is 42 years old, married and lives with her husband and three children in the Distrito de La Matanza [The District of the Massacre]. This community, located in the Morropon province which belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru, lives off of agriculture, trade and livestock.

She makes a living selling beer and raising young animals. She is an entrepreneurial woman who makes an effort in the work she carries out. She is recognized in her village for the work she does. 

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy beer in bulk to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy beer in bulk to restock her business.

loans.name: Zamzam Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Zamzam Al- Hodeidah. It consists of four women who are all hardworking and live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Zamzam is a 31-year-old married woman living with her spouse in a poor area in Hodeidah. She studied until an elementary education, but she couldn't complete her study. She has a strong determination to improve her living standards. She said that in the beginning, she had a small amount of money which she saved up herself. Zamzam invested that money in her own business. She has started her business for many months, selling makeup and accessories in order to help her husband with the expenses of the family. She sees this business as her favorite business. For further expansion, Zamzam requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to sell to the women in her area.

Zamzam expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business by opening a small shop to sell many kinds of drinks and sandwiches for the children in the schools in her area.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Naser Allah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Naser Allah. It consists of six women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 270,000 YER from AMB.

Zahra is a 51-year-old widow with six children, living with her children in their own house in Sana'a. She is an uneducated woman, but she knows how to run the affairs of the house very well. Zahra's family depends upon the salary of the father who passed away several years ago. He worked as a solider in the army. His salary is not enough to cover all the necessities of the house. Now, the family lives in a miserable condition. Zahra did not surrender to that condition but decided to improve the living standards of her family. Her house lacks many home appliances and most of the furniture inside the house is very old. For this reason, Zahra applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture for the house.

Zahra looks forward to improving the living condition of her family. She hopes to send her children to private schools. She plans to furnish all her house with new furniture.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the house.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 30 years old. He is hard working and very ambitious. He operates his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in a town called Kabwe, located in the central province of Zambia. This will be Paul’s fourth loan from Kiva. He has successfully repaid all his previous loans on time. 

Being a Kiva beneficiary has allowed Paul to grow his business. He now has eight outlets and employs eleven young adults across his network of mobile money outlets. His personal life has also improved greatly. He now lives in a fully furnished house and is able to help out his family members with things like food, housing, and school fees for his young niece. He would like to thank the Kiva lenders for their continued support throughout the years.
 
Paul is applying for a new loan so that he can increase the working capital across his eight shops. This will allow Paul to serve his customers more efficiently as he will have increased cash flow for the hundreds of customers who transact at his outlets on a daily basis.

loans.use: to have more cash on hand for processing money transfers across his eight shops.

loans.name: Alh. Usaini

texts.en: Alh. Usaini is a 70-year-old farmer from Danju. As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Usaini is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Alh. Usaini can earn up to 2,000 USD/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alh. Usaini is ambitious and is aiming to reap 57 bags per hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality maize inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Idris

texts.en: Idris is a 50-year-old farmer from Dankwaire. As a Babban Gona member, Idris is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Idris can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Idris is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children, Dalladi, Uzaifa, and Ummaru. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Sasa Ni Kazi Group

texts.en:
Steven, who is in his late 30s, is married with four children who are still at school. He has been a courier for five years. He transports his customers' luggage. He works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Steven's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He will buy items like onions, beans from the farmers and transport them to Dar. He dreams of buying more trucks for his business.

Steven will share this loan with his loan group Sasa Ni Kazi, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  he will buy items like onions, beans from the farmers and transport them to Dar.

loans.name: Mt. Livingstone Group

texts.en:
Rehana is in her early forties, married, and has three children, all in school. She runs a Genge-Duka (a retail shop selling fruits, vegetables, sodas, water, sugar, rice, maize, baking flour, etc.). She has been in business for twelve months. Rehana works at her business from 6:00 a.m. to midnight every work day and is able to make a good profit each month. She dreams of managing a big food shop and making her life better.

She is requesting a second loan via Tujijenge Tanzania. This group loan will be apportioned among Mt. Livingstone's four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Rehana used her portion of the previous loan, which she paid back successfully, to replenish her Genge-Duka with rice, beans, and sugar. She will use her portion of this second loan to buy stock of sodas, juice, water, cigarettes, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy stock of sodas, juice, water, cigarettes, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy is married with one child and she goes to school. She sells green bananas at the market and has been in this business for five years.  She takes care of one additional family member. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  She gets additional income from farming. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation, which makes movement of her products to the market difficult. She is aspiring to educate her children to the university level. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and food.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with seven children, five of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling Cavendish bananas and has been in this business for 14 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspires to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to build rental rooms on the land she owns. She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of Cavendish bananas.

loans.name: Hoseah

texts.en:
Hoseah is a married man. He describes himself to be honest.

He operates a retail business where he sells fabric. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough resources.

He will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fabric. His business goal is to expand business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fabric

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married woman. He has four children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, salt, soap and other items. His business is located in a marketable place. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, sweets, bread and other items. His business goal is to have a bigger retail shop within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, sweets, bread and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nahashon

texts.en:
Nahashon, age 32 years,  is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school.  He lives at his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby.  He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Nahashon dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan of KES 25,000 that he is requesting, he wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice for sale.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice for sale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Mwanamisi is requesting for another loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. She appreciates the support of the previous loan from Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret has owned a food stall business.The business has grown and the clients, as well, are many. Here again she comes to you requesting for a loan of  20,000 KES. She wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children all under her care. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Margaret wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business but currently she has a boutique where she sells clothes for both men and women. Her major goal is to become a leading  business lady in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason with the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en: Ismael is a 21-year-old university student majoring in Civil Engineering, and he is in his third year. He lives with his family consisting of his parents and his five siblings in Irbid, Jordan. His father is a taxi driver and his income isn't enough to cover his family needs. For that, Ismael is planning to find a good job in his study field in the future so that he can help his family financially. But he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his registration and semester fees.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 32 years old and has been operating his Zoona mobile money business for the past five years. He recently got married and because of the success of his business Alan was able to sponsor the wedding without much trouble.  

He is grateful to Kiva lenders for the financial help throughout the years. The loans Allan has graciously received have empowered him to increase his working capital and expand his business. Now, Allan operates three outlets in the tourist town of Livingstone, Zambia, home to beautiful Victoria Falls. With his business growth Allan has empowered the youth in his community to work at his outlet locations. 

Currently, Allan has six employees and he plans to hire more as his business continues to grow. With Allan's growing business he employs six young adults to help with the day-to-day operations as well as providing for his extended family when financial needs arise. When walking around the bus station in Livingstone all the locals know Allan and his successful business providing financial services to Zambians. He is a well-known community figure now who shows what hard work and dedication can do, all while providing a needed service for his community members. 

Allan is requesting a Kiva loan to help him open another Zoona money transfer outlet. This will allow him to increase his footprint in the town and employ another shop teller to assist at the new location. He will use the loan to purchase the trading booth and have adequate working capital to serve all his customers money transfer and bill payment needs. Allan would like to express his thanks to the Kiva lenders for their valuable support in allowing him to scale up his business and improve his community.

loans.use: to purchase another trading booth and have cash on hand to meet his customers' money transfer and bill payment requirements.

loans.name: Auwalu

texts.en: Auwalu remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Auwalu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to 2,000 USD/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Auwalu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In five years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” expressed Auwalu. With this loan, Auwalu is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality maize inputs, such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an over sewing machine.

loans.name: Hamson

texts.en:
Hamson is a 25-year-old single resident of Makindye. He is an old client of UGAFODE and a very good payer. He has been running a loan of 2,000,000 for 8 months and he has now applied for a loan of 3,000,000. He is a motorcycle (boda boda) rider and the purpose of the loan is to buy another motorcycle to increase his income.

His future plans are to borrow more money and start a farm in his home area. He is a very honest and aggressive young man who loves working and is also committed to his job. He greatly appreciates the efforts of the funders, especially for the support given to him despite him being a young man.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jasobant

texts.en:
Jasobant, an active lady of 50 years, is a permanent resident of Kortipadar village in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. She hails from a poor family and her husband runs a cycle repair center in the nearest town. Her family consists of her husband, two sons and her mother in-law.  Jasobant’s younger son named Pramod is attending the second year of +2 sciences at Khariar Junior College of Khariar. He is a good scholar and wants to continue his study. 

Pramod's tuition is not affordable by his parents from their present income. The monthly income of Jasobant from her husband’s cycle repair center is about 8,000 INR, which is not at all sufficient to meet her monthly expenditures. Hence, when Mahashakti Foundation started an education loan program, she applied for it and took a loan of 30,000 INR. With this loan, Jasobant will pay the admission fee and tuition fees and will purchase books and study materials for her son. After successful completion of his +2 studies, Jasobant hopes to give some technical education to her son for his bright future. The lady with her hand raised in the photo is Jasobant and her son is sitting with her.
