loans.use: To pay the admission fee and tuition fees and purchase books and study materials for her son.

loans.name: Archana

texts.en:
Archana is a 23-year-old housewife from Maynaguri. She is married to Subhas, 35 years old. They have a very young son. Archana and her husband both completed education up to secondary level. They live in their own house in the village Petkati in the district Jalpaiguri.

Archana is a homemaker and her husband has a business of selling Ayurvedic medicines (medicine made from herbs). Throughout the day she manages all the household work and her husband sells medicines from their own shop. He purchases medicines from wholesale markets and sells to his retail customers. 

Archana and her husband want to extend the business because their medicines are in great demand in their area. There is only one shop far away in the village but they don't have the enough capital to invest on their business. She came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and requested a loan to buy more necessary medicines. 

In the future, she wants to become a good entrepreneur and wants to improve her business gradually with the profit. She hopes, with the profit from her business, to improve her family's condition and admit her child to a renowned school.

Archana sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To buy necessary medicines for their Ayurvedic medicine shop.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a 39-year-old woman from a remote region of Jalpaiguri district.  She is married, a housewife and a mother of two sons. She is married to Nikhilranjan, 46 years old.  Basanti has a primary education and her husband attended school until grade nine. But they are very much concerned about their children's education. Their children are in grade 9 and grade 10.

Basanti's husband is associated with the business of making incense sticks.  He has been operating this business for the last 10 years. He makes incense sticks with the help of his spouse. He works hard the whole day for their family. Basanti assists her husband in this work after managing her household work.  Now they need to invest money to grow his business to cope with their present economic situation when prices of essential commodities are increasing daily.  It is a very profitable business in her area and does not involve much labor cost.

Basanti has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) in order to extend her business.  She wants to purchase raw materials for making incense.  She will sell them at the market as well as door to door to her neighbors for more profit.  There is a high demand for this product in her locality.  She hopes it will improve the family's financial condition.  She wants to further improve her business to give the family economic stability.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima calurosa, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, en un caserío cercano a Pucará y lo comercializa a un acopiador conocido de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rubén is 26 years old, and he lives with his wife and children in the district of Pucará. It is a community with a warm climate, where the people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located within the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region of Peru’s Northern Sierra.

He grows coffee in a small village near Pucará, and he sells it to a middle-man who is known in the zone. He has requested a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop, and in this way, generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija, age 26 and unmarried, runs a convenience store to earn a living. She began her business two years ago in order to cover her living expenses and to improve her standard of living. Her family was unable to provide her with an education beyond the elementary level, so she was unable to find a more lucrative way to earn an income.

Khadija is requesting a youth loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua. Her goal is to add to her business merchandise with special summer beverages and Holy Ramadan dates (special dried fruits highly requested during Ramadan season).
 
She is anxious about this loan, which is her first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower, but she hopes that through this and future loans she can continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special summer beverages and Holy Ramadan Dates

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Yusuf joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children. Yusuf is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Yusuf will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Yusuf can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to 2,000 USD/hectare: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to build a better home.” Yusuf is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs, such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for her sister's education fees.

loans.name: Pappu Kumar

texts.en:
Pappu lives in Hatnaga village in Jharkhand. He is 30 years old, married and has a son and three daughters. He runs a stall where he sells toys and garlands. His business is in demand during mela (fair) season, which happens once a year from July until October. He earns around 50,000 INR per year from this shop. He also has a farm where he cultivates crops and sells them in the market for additional income. 

Pappu wants to add more toys and garlands to his shop for which he is requesting a loan of 25,000 INR. 

Pappu wants to give a good education to all his children and hopes for better living standards. His dream is to own a permanent shop in his locality.

loans.use: to buy more toys and garlands for his shop

loans.name: Al- Sadaka Group

texts.en:
Al- Sadaka is a group which is comprised of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Eshrak is the leader of the group. She is a 40-year-old married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 22 years old and the youngest one is 2 years old. She studied until Secondary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Eshrak's husband is an employee in a private sector with a small salary. Due to his small salary, his family lives with an economical crisis most days. So, Eshrak wants to help her husband with the expenses of her family and she wants to improve their living standards. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for her house to eat and to increase the living standards of her family.

Eshrak looks forward to preparing her house with all kinds of foods materials in order to have a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, a table, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a generator, fabric, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soap, oil, flour, bread, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase car spare parts and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Uheri Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mateene est une commerçante  d’une expérience de 5 ans, âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, dont 1 étudie et 3 sont encore gosses. Elle est membre d’un collectif d’Affaires «Uheri». Elle est vendeuse des habits (tissus). Elle installe  sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 20 pièces de tissus. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un taximan motard. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs  non bancables, en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Mateene, the featured borrower, is 32 years old, married and the mother of four children.  One of her children is in school (the other three are still very young).  Mateene has five years of experience in her field of work.  She is a member of the "Uheri" business group and she sells clothing (fabrics) at a market in town.  She is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima, in order to increase her business.  She will use her loan to buy 20 pieces of fabrics.  Mateene started her activity with some money received from her husband who provides taxi services on his motorcycle.

In the future, Mateene would like to further increase her activity, be able to send her children to school and to buy food for them.  She thanks Hekima for the support it provides, through micro-credit, to female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the banking system. She is particularly thankful given the fact that Hekima is providing this support while the eastern part of the country is still in a post-conflict period.  

It should be noted that one of the borrowers featured in the photo is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers and lappa to sell.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is a 20 year old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest and disciplined. She operates a mitumba where she sells clothing. She has been involved in this business for one year. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price of stock fluctuations. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of clothes. Her business goal is to grow into a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she can expand the business and use the profits to generate other income. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de conservas de pescado (atún) por cajas al por mayor y menor, desde hace 5 años su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería por cajas y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is 46 years old.  He lives with his wife and child in his own house.  He has good personal and work references from his neighbors.  They live in a large community in the urban zone of Cayalti.  Its population works in agriculture, trade, and ranching.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

He works selling boxes of canned tuna, both wholesale and retail.  For the past five years his business has been located in his own home.  He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy merchandise in boxes, and in this way to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in boxes to stock his business

loans.name: Utulivu B Group

texts.fr: Solange est une commerçante, vice présidente et membre de la banque villageoise «Utulivu B», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 32ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants, qui encore gosses. La cliente est vendeuse de la boisson. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une buvette à son domicile dans un quartier animé de la ville, où, il a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de ses parents. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 caisses de fanta sucré, 10 caisses de bière Primus, 2 meetzing. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
The featured borrower, Solange, works in retail.  She is also a member and the vice-president of a village bank called "Utulivu B".  She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two very young children.  She is a dynamic entrepreneur who sells drinks.  She has a stall, at home, on which she displays her merchandise.  She lives in a busy part of town, which helped her to attract many customers.  She started her activity with an initial capital received from her parents.  Later on, she took a loan from Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Hekima.  She now has three years of experience in her field of work.

With this new loan, she will be able to buy five crates of sweet Fanta, ten crates of Primus beer and two crates of Metzingen beer.  In the future, she would like to be able to feed and educate her children.  She thanks Hekima for empowering small-scale entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy five crates of sweet Fanta, ten crates of Primus beer and two crates of Metzingen beer.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes, desde hace más de 8 años, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceites, entre otros para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 45 years old.  He lives together with his wife and children in a small community in the rural part of Cayalti.  The people there work in agriculture, trade, and ranching.  It is located in Chiclayo Province, which belongs to the Lambayaque region, on the north coast of Peru.  He has good personal and work references from his neighbors.

He has worked selling groceries for more than eight years.  He has a good-sized clientele.  He has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 nuevos soles to buy rice, sugar, and oils, among other items to stock his business.  In this way he can generate better earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil, rice, salt, pepper, etc to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, a feather removal machine, a grill machine and a generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and generator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough foodstuffs, bags of rice, gallons of oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Isagani Jr

texts.en:
Isagani Jr. is 56 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child, now at his school age. 

Isagani Jr. has been engaged in a fish vending activity, using his motorcycle, for four years already and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month from doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional banyeras (tubs) of fish for retail. Isagani Jr. has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Isagani Jr. hopes to acquire fish stall in the market as an expansion of his business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional banyeras (tubs) of fish for retail

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 49 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, now at their adult age. 

Lydia has been engaged in an electronic load (prepaid cell phone credits) retailing business for 3 years already. She is earning approximately 1,500 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing load for retail.

Lydia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Lydia hopes to engage in other forms of business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing electronic loads for retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Sari Maju Group

texts.en:
Entering their 7th loan cycle, most of the Sari Maju Group members have succeeded with their pig raising business. They manage the pigs with a good way and the result brings a satisfied profit. The incomes can support their life, support the education of their children, and provide them savings. This time, two of the members decided to resign because they had enough money as capital to continue the pig business. The Sari Maju has one new member.

Having evaluated the pig business, now the group expects a new loan, not only for the pig business, but also, to begin to use in a farming business. With the loan, they will purchase piglets as well as various kinds of seeds (chilli, nuts, cacao) and fertilizer. They want to improve their life by running multiple businesses. Ni Komang uses her loans to purchase piglets, chilli, and nuts seeds as well as fertilizer. They are really grateful and thankful to lenders, Kiva, and MUK for supporting their lives. The loan and program has proven to increase their standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets as well as various kinds of seeds (chilli, nuts, cacao) and fertilizer

loans.name: Utulivu A Group

texts.fr: La cliente Colette  est une doyenne commerçante et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Utulivu A », entrepreneur, âgée de 45 ans, mariée  et mère de 7 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un dépôt du centre commercial  de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de ses parents. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Il y a 25 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 22 sacs de maïs et de soja. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The featured borrower, Colette, is an experienced retailer and a member of the "Utulivu A" busines group. She is a 45 year-old-entrepreneur, married, and the mother of seven children who all attend school.  Colette sells food products.  She displays her merchandise in town, at a warehouse which is part of  a commercial center.  She started her activity with an initial capital received from her parents.  Her husband is not employed.  Colette has 25 years of experience in her field of work.  With this new loan, she will be able to buy 22 sacks of maize and soya beans.  In the future, she would like to be able to feed, clothe and educate her children. She thanks Hekima for empowering female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this critical post-conflict period in eastern Congo.

loans.use: to buy 22 sacks of maize and soya beans.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Anita is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more spices and vegetables to sell.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita works hard to support her family. Enelita is married and has a cow-raising business in the Philippines.

She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional cow to raise.

Enelita has been in this business for one year now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Enelita would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow to raise

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Dorotea works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Dorotea is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Dorotea has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tet Fret De Dumas 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Antoine est le coordinateur de son groupe Tet Fret de Dumas 1, 2, 3 & 4. Il est un commercant. Il habite dans la région de Dumas où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Antoine a dirigé son commerce de produit divers et charbon pendant 13 années. 

Avant de commencer ce commerce, Antoine était un Etudiant. Antoine voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le charbon, chaussures, vetement, et divers produit. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme nourriture, cosmetiques, charbon, etc. Antoine dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Antoine, who works in retail, is the coordinator of the "Tet Fret de Dumas 1, 2, 3 & 4" group.  He lives in the Dumas region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and access to water very limited.  He has been running his own business, selling charcoal and various other products, for the past 13 years.

Before he started in this business, Antoine used to be a student.  He would now like to use his loan to buy charcoal, shoes, clothes and various other products.  He is hoping that this loan will help him to grow his business.  The group's other members also need a loan in order to operate their own food, cosmetics and charcoal businesses.

Antoine says that his main ambition and his dream are to gather enough money to acquire a major business, through God's grace.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, clothes, shoes etc.

loans.name: Elinda

texts.en:
Elinda is 60 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a dried coconut meat business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more dried coconut meat to sell.

Elinda has been in this business for 45 years.

In the future Elinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Felix is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotun. This community, dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock farming, is located in the province of Chiclayo, belonging to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

For several years now, he has been making a living raising and placing smaller animals on the market. His business is located behind his home.

He has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, for the purchase of a variety of animals, and in this way to generate better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of animals.

loans.name: Horm's Group

texts.en:
Horm is 43-year-old, married citizen from the Bovel district of Battambang province. She grows rice and peanuts as the main source of income. Besides this agribusiness, she sells grocery items and works for others to supplement her income.

Horm is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and her living condition is getting better than before. In addition to her business loan, she and her entire group applied for a consumption loan. For Horm, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a household appliance for her family. She hopes to provide sufficient household materials for her family.

loans.use: to buy a household appliance for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Ng’Ndu

texts.en:
Ng’ndu is 47 years old. He is married with two children, ages twelve and three. He is an accountant by profession who now runs a micro distribution center (MDC). He sells wholesale Coca-Cola  products to local retailers and customers. Ng’ndu is based in Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia. This business is located at one of the biggest markets in a crowded area of Kalingalinga.

Ng’ndu says he enjoys running his business because he is able to interact with different people in his community and other small business owners. His business also allows him to provide for his family’s needs. Ng’ndu’s main challenge is access to capital. He says he has been unable to grow his business because he does not have enough money to add to his existing capital base.  With additional capital Ng’ndu would be able scale up his business by purchasing additional stock. 

Ng’ndu has applied for a Kiva loan to increase his capital reserves so that he can purchase additional stock for the container from which he operates.  This stock includes Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite. This increase in working capital will enable him to purchase the necessary stock for which his wholesalers and customers are asking. Ng’ngu is excited about the opportunity this access to finance will bring his family and business.

loans.use: to buy Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is a 61-year-old widow with adult children. Her major source of income is from selling grocery items. She has been in this business for two decades already. The business helped her to meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income, due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She previously obtained loans to purchase additional stocks and is re-applying a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur with her family. She owns and operates a fishing business for more than seven years to earn a living. She earns well from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for fishing materials. She had to find ways to improve her business, as her family's demand is getting higher. This is because her children are going to their higher-level school. She recently took a new loan.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es de la ciudad de Concepción, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería comercial, comenta que su meta principal es ejercer su carrera como agrónoma y servir a las empresas ya sea privadas o públicas de la mejor forma.
Su mayor anhelo es trabajar con una empresa privada para ganar mejor y poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera, y así seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Blanca is from the city of Concepcion. She is studying Commercial Engineering, and says that her main goal is to pursue her career as an agronomist, and serve companies, both private and public, in the best way. Her greatest desire is to work with a private company to earn more and be able to help her family. She is asking for this loan to be able to cover the fees of her studies, and to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay University fees

loans.name: Ferlen

texts.en:
Ferlen has been selling ice candy in their village to earn additional income to support her husband. She has been doing this for many years. She also sells some of this in school where she gets more return.

She recently joined GDMPC to borrow a new loan. It will be used for raw ingredients to make fruit salad and ice candy to sell. She is photographed near her refrigerator, where some of her income goes.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make fruit salad and ice candy to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, while earning additional income from farming rice. Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Geraldine works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear and from motorcycle transportation. Graldine is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, and spices for her general store.

Geraldine has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to expand her business. Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, noodles, spices, and other items.

loans.name: Sarantañani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARANTAÑANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gladys es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, tienda de barrio, diseño de ropa en cinta, tienda de abarrotes y huevos, venta de chinelas, servicio de transporte, librería, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gladys es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años de su madre quien negociaba el mismo producto en los mercados de su ciudad, es por ello que decide emprender un negocio independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta, esta forma le ayuda a generar recursos para su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sarantañani” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Gladys is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling potatoes, managing a neighborhood store, designing clothes, operating a grocery store, selling eggs, selling slippers, providing transportation services, managing a bookstore, and selling clothes.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Gladys. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a client of the organization. Gladys currently has a business of selling potatoes. She has become knowledgeable about this business since she started several years ago by working with her mother, who sells the same product at the markets in their city. From that point, Gladys decided to establish an independent business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying potatoes in bulk. She acquires her products from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and then sells them from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for her family. Gladys is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Gladys said that she enjoys the health services and the training sessions offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Ma. Ramila

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Ramila works hard to support her family. She sells frozen foods in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Ma. Ramila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Ma. Ramila has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a 46-year-old widow with one child, who is currently in school. Nimfa is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nimfa has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Las Guapas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama LAS GUAPAS inician el 4to. Ciclo, es un grupo de mujeres que desde hace más de 2 años vienen trabajando con la Fundación, con la idea de poder mejorar sus vidas por medio del trabajo unido. Todas las integrantes cuentan con capacitaciones, seguimientos, con lo cual quieren ir mejorando sus vidas.
La sra. Guillermina es una de las integrantes, ella es madre de familia, y cuenta que tiene 2 hijos pequeños. Guillermina es una mujer, que desde muy tempranas horas del día empieza con su trabajo de costura. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo. Ellas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called LAS GUAPAS and it is in its fourth loan cycle.  It is a group of women who have been working with the Foundation for over two years now in order to improve their lives through working together.  All of its members have been through training and follow-up courses, which they want to use to improve their lives. 

Guillermina is one of these members.  She is a mother and has two small children.  Guillermina is a woman who starts her sewing work in the very early hours of the day.  

She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, and other things so she can keep doing her work.  They are thankful for the opportunity they are receiving to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, and other things

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en:
This group can repay their loan on time. They sell pigs with a good price. Now, the price for pork is about Rp. 70,000 per kilogram. Kadek, the head of the group, maintains four local pigs which have all sold, earning a profit of 2,000,000 IDR. She’s really grateful for that. She has a plan to use the profit to renovate her house and to save.

She did not have a problem during the previous loan period and all of her pigs grew well. She thanks Kiva lenders and MUK for supporting her business.

The ten-member Sumbersari Permai group received a loan for the 8th time, in the amount of 15,000,000 IDR. Having been successful with maintaining a local pig, Kadek will use this loan to purchase four superior pigs. The current price of pig feed is very expensive, but she remains optimistic about its business going forward. The group and Kadek expect to be continually accompanied by MUK’s staff and the Vet.

loans.use: to purchase four superior pigs.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Carlita sells snacks as her business.  She is happy to know that it is doing well, especially when she doubles her time to perfect her own snack recipes. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and continues to pursue her goals for the good of her family. She is requesting another loan from PMPC to buy more raw ingredients for her snack vending business. Today, Carlita is able to comfortably provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients for her snack business.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida: Es una señora amable, tiene 40 años, casada con 5 hijos, el mayor de 23 años es independiente, dos adolescentes que estudian su primaria secundaria y dos menores de edad. Cuenta con una experiencia de 5 años de ser enfermera. Su esposo trabaja en una institución del gobierno central. Desde hace 24 años habita en una casa de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida. Solicita financiamiento para construir pantry y muebles de madera para su cocina. Su sueño es tener una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en: Elida is a kind person.  She is 40 years old, married, and has five children; the eldest, who is 23 years old, is independent, two are adolescents who are in high school and primary school, and two are minors.  She has five years of experience as a nurse.  Her husband works for a central government institution.  For 24 years she has lived in a wooden house on stilts.  With the goal of improving her home and improving her quality of life, she is requesting a loan to build a pantry and wooden furniture for her kitchen.  Her dream is to have a home with proper accommodations.

loans.use: to build a pantry and wooden furniture for her kitchen

loans.name: Irving Federico

texts.es: Irving: Es un joven cordial, soltero, originario de Managua, desde hace 5 años se trasladó al Municipio de Rosita, por motivos laborales. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda en Managua, solicita su primer financiamiento para mejorar el techo de su baño y solventar deudas de servicios básicos. Su sueño es establecer un negocio en Rosita.
texts.en: Iriving is a friendly, singly young man from Managua.  Five years ago he transferred to the municipality of Rosita for work.  In order to improve his home in Managua, he is requesting his first loan to improve the roof in his bathroom and pay his utilities bills.  His dream is to start a business in Rosita.

loans.use: to improve the roof in his bathroom and pay his utilities bills

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Santa Librada está en el ciclo número 9 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza donde todas por medio de su esfuerzo irán mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ignacia quien se dedica al comercio, es decir tiene un Kiosko en su casa y también se dedica a la venta de leche. Gracias a esta actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos. Según su última encuesta se encuentra bastante bien, mejorando cada vez más. También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su kiosko, como ser golosinas, jugos, gaseosas y demás. Agradece ya que por medio de su trabajo podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called Santa Librada and it is in its ninth loan cycle with the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras program, where they all work and help each other in order to get ahead.  They are taking part in a survey on the elimination of poverty through which they will all improve their living conditions through their work.  

One of the group members is Ignacia, who works in commerce, which is to say she has a refreshments stand in her home and she also sells milk.   Thanks to this business she is able to support her household and progressively increase her income.  According to her latest survey she is doing fairly well and getting better every time.  The work of the advisers should also be recognized, as they carry out permanent monitoring of trainings and verifications. 

She is requesting this loan to buy various supplies for her refreshments stand, such as candy, juices, sodas, and more.  She is thankful because through her work she will be able to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy candy, juices, sodas, and other supplies

loans.name: Delia María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Los Capuchinos.
En este lugar vive la señora Delia, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  dos hijos, uno mayor y otro de 14  años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una institución del gobierno.
Doña Delia con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata, productos Avon, Yanbal y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa por catalogo, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta  y cobra semanalmente, esto lo viene realizando desde hace 27 años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar joyas, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos.  Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  3 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le solucionan sus problemas de dinero. Sus sueños es ver que su hijo termine sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Los Capuchinos” meet every 15 days in the neighborhood of San Cristóbal in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. For many years, Portoviejo has been known as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” (The Royal Tamarind Trees).

Sra. Delia lives in this place. She is 51 years old, married, and has two children. One is an adult and the other is a 14-year-old high school student. Her husband works at a government institution.

With the intent of having her own income, Doña Delia sells silver jewelry and products from Avon, Yanbal, and Belcorp (including beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She also sells clothing through catalogs. Delia works every day, but mostly during the morning hours since it is easier to get around during that time. Her sales are conducted by going door-to-door and she collects payments on a weekly basis. Delia has been in this line of work for 27 years and is doing very well since she has a significant clientele. The products that she sells the most are cosmetics and perfumes.

This loan will be used to buy jewelry, perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crèmes, and other products. Delia has been with her Communal Bank for three years and enjoys being a member because the loans have resolved her money problems. Her dreams include seeing her son finish his studies and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crèmes, and other products.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es: Olga Lidia: Es originaria de Rosita, tiene 35 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos, en edad escolar. Cuenta con una experiencia de 9 años de ser docente, su esposo trabaja como vigilante. Con el propósito de solventar algunos gastos del hogar y médicos, solicita financiamiento para viajar a Managua a realizarse análisis. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda, habita en una casa de tambo de madera.
texts.en: Olga Lidia is from Rosita; she is 35 years old, married, and has four school-age children.  She has nine years of experience working as a teacher and her husband works as a security guard.  In order to cover some household and medical expenses, she is requesting a loan to travel to Managua to have some tests done.  Her dream is to improve her home; she lives in a wooden house on stilts.

loans.use: to travel to Managua to have some tests done.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, cookies, toilet paper, and other products.

loans.name: Lumiere Celeste De Grande Savanne Group

texts.fr:
Israel est le coordinateur de son groupe Lumiere de Celeste de Grande Savanne. Il habite dans la région de Grande Savanne, d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il a dirigé son commerce de chaussures pendant 6 années. Israel est marié et a 3 enfants. 

Israel voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l'achat de chaussures. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres Lumière Celeste ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, produit divers, vetement. Israel dit que ses défis principal est deveniez une grande commerçant. Il dit que son but principal et son rêve est possède une gros business avec sa propre fond avec la mercy de Dieu
texts.en:
Israel is the coordinator of the "Lumiere Celeste de Grande Savanne" group.  He lives in the "Grande Savanne" region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and access to water very limited.  He has been running his own shoe sales business for the past six years.  He is married and the father of three children.

Israel would like to use his loan to buy shoes.  He hopes that this loan will help him to grow his business.  The other members of the  "Lumière Celeste" group also need loans to operate their own businesses, as they sell charcoal, clothes, and various other goods.

Israel says that his main challenge is to become a major retailer.  He also says that his ambition and dream is to use his own funds to acquire a major business one day, by the Grace of God.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 6º del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, con la cual podrán ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida por medio de su lucha y trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nelida, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, la cual con mucho esfuerzo ha ido formando. Comenta que al principio le fue muy difícil, pero que se fue abriendo camino y hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser carne, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás, y así seguir con sus ventas como lo vine haciendo. Agradece por esta ayuda que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas Group is in its sixth loan cycle with the women's communal bank program.  They are doing a survey on the elimination of poverty, which will allow them to improve their living conditions through their effort and work.  

On of the group's members is Nelida, who has a well-stocked small grocery store in her home, which she has been building up through a lot of hard work.  She tells us that in the beginning it was very hard for her, but that she has been making progress and now she has a very good clientele. 

She is requesting this loan to buy various supplies for her small grocery store, such as meat, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and more, and thereby maintain her sales as she has been.  She is thankful for the help she is receiving, as it will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and more

loans.name: Heshle

texts.en:
Heshle is 44 years old and married with one child.
She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF.  She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.
Heshle has borrowed and paid back 21 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.
She aspires to build and expand her business to help secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina works hard to support her family. Carolina is married and has a dressmaking business in the Philippines.
Carolina has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fabric, threads, zippers, buttons, etc. for her business.
Carolina has been in this business for 20 years now.
Carolina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as fabric, threads, zippers, buttons, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mario Jesus

texts.es: Mario Jesús: Es un señor jovial, tienen 62 años de edad, casado con 3 hijos: 2 mayores de edad y un adolecente que estudia su cuarto año de secundaria. Trabaja como conductor en una institución del gobierno central. Su esposa es ama de casa. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda, solicita su segundo financiamiento para mejorar el techo de su vivienda y construir un muro de minifalda de concreto y madera, comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, clavos, zinc, madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Desde hace 4 años habita en una casa de minifalda de concreto y madera, en la que conviven 8 personas. Su sueño es construir una vivienda en un terreno que tiene deshabitado para sus hijos.
texts.en: Mario Jesús is a kind man.  He is 62 years old, married, and has three children; two adults and one teenager who is in his fourth year of high school.  He works as a driver for a central government institution.  His wife is a homemaker.  In order to improve his home, he is requesting a second loan to improve the roof on his home and to build a wall with a cement base and wood panels.  He will buy construction materials: cement, nails, sheet metal, and wood, and cover labor costs.  For four years he has lived in a house with a concrete base and wooden walls where eight people live together.  His dream is to build a home on a plot of land he has kept vacant for his children.

loans.use: to improve the roof on his home and to build a wall with a  concrete base and wood panels

loans.name: Simona Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Simona Esperanza, labora como comerciante en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desempeñando esta labor desde hace 25 años, es madre3 soltera de 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno está bajo su cargo, inicia su actividad laboral ambulante con venta de pan con un capital de trabajo de C$ 200.00 producto de préstamos, comienza su día laborar a las 6:00 am y finalizándolas a las 5:00 pm con un horario de lunes a Domingo, ella realiza esta labor para la mantención de su humilde vivienda.

La Señora Simona Esperanza solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el cual fue utilizado para la compra de toallas  de diferentes tamaños, mosquiteros, colchas, faldas, blusas, gorras, etc., esto le permitirá aumentar su negocio con productos de mejor calidad, mayor desarrollo económico y así ha logrado que su calidad de vida mejore día a día.
texts.en:
Sra. Simona Esperanza works as a merchant at one of the markets in the city of León. She has been doing this type of work for 25 years. Simona is a single mother of four children, but they are no longer under her care. She started out working as a street vendor selling bread with operating capital in the amount of 200 NIO that she obtained through loans. Simona begins her work day at 6:00 A.M. and finishes at 5:00 P.M., Monday through Sunday. She works in order to maintain her modest home.

Sra. Simona Esperanza is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy towels in different sizes, mosquito nets, bedspreads, skirts, blouses, caps, and other items. This will enable her to increase her business with products of better quality. By improving her financial development, she will be able to improve her quality of life each day.

loans.use: to buy towels in different sizes, mosquito nets, bedspreads, skirts, blouses, caps, and other items.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora de 45 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos de los cuales 3 están trabajando y aportan a la economía familiar. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida gracias a su trabajo en un centro de nutrición infantil, su esposo también aporta a los gastos familiares por medio de su trabajo en una cooperativa de transporte. Ella desea hacer algunas reparaciones muy necesarias en su vivienda tales como: reparar la pila y comprar la puerta por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar la puerta de su vivienda, cemento, ladrillo, hierro, y pagará mano de obra para reparación de pila de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora is 45 years old and lives with her husband and five children, three of whom are working in order to help with the family’s finances. She is a tenacious woman who earns a living thanks to her job at a child nutrition center. Her husband also contributes to the family’s expenses through his job working for a transportation cooperative.

Dora wants to make a few necessary repairs to her home that include fixing the water basin and buying a door. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to buy a door for her home, cement, bricks, and iron. She will also pay for labor so that the water basin in her home gets repaired.

loans.use: to buy a door for her home, construction materials, and pay for labor in order to repair the water basin.

loans.name: Les Rayons De Bord De Mere Group

texts.fr:
Bertheleine est la coordinatrice de son groupe Les Rayons de Bord de mere. Elle es une commercante. Elle habite dans la région Bord-de-Mere d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Bertheleine a dirigé son commerce de Produit Divers pendant 13 années.

Avant de commencer ce commerce Bertheleine était un couturiere. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le produit divers avec chaussures, cosmetiques, vetement, etc. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business de Produit divers. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme Charbon, Vetement, chaussures, entre autre.

Bertheleine dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Elle dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Bertheleine, who works in retail, is the coordinator of the "Les Rayons de Bord de Mere" group. She lives in the "Bord-de-Mere" region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and access to water very limited. She has been running her own retail business and selling various goods, for the past 13 years. 

Before she started in this business, Bertheleine used to be a seamstress.  She would now like to use this loan to buy various goods such as shoes, cosmetic products, clothes etc.  She hopes that this loan will help her to grow her retail business.  The other members of the group also need loans to operate their own businesses, as they sell charcoal, clothes, shoes and various other goods.

Bertheline says that her main challenge is to become a major retailer. She also says that her dream and ambition are to use her own funds to acquire a major business one day, by the Grace of God.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetic products, clothes etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Luby Aleyda

texts.es: Luby Aleyda: Es una señora alegre, originaria de Rosita, tiene 31 años, madre soltera de un hijo de 7 años de edad, que cursa su segundo grado. Cuenta con una experiencia de 14 años. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda, solicita su segundo financiamiento para ampliar su sala y mejorar el techo de su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y vivienda, comprar materiales de construcción: zinc, clavos, maderas, bloques, cemento. Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones necesarias a su familia.
texts.en:
Luby Aleyda: a happy woman originally from Rosita, 31 years old and single mother of a seven year old boy in second grade. She has 14 years of experience.

With the goal of improving her home she requests her second loan to expand her living room and improve the roof of her heavy base, concrete home. Also to buy construction materials: zinc, nails, wood, concrete blocks and cement. Her dream is to have a home that provides the necessary conditions for her family.

loans.use: to expand her living room and make improvements to the roof of her heavy base, concrete home and to her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goods and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and air-conditioner.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and air-conditioner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gowns, a sewing machine table and fabric.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 35 years old and married with four children who are all attending school.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. Marialyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marialyn has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel works hard to support her family. Isabel is married and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Isabel requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Isabel has been in this business for six years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings, spices, etc., for her food production business.

Cecilia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings, spices, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-production business business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Emma has been in this business for eight years. Emma earns more income from farming rice.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough gallons of oil, bags of rice, etc.

loans.name: Campo Verde Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CAMPO VERDE” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, tienda de bario, producción de leche y queso, venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de ganadería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que desde niño ella apoyo a su familia, por ello ya conocía el manejo de este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de forraje por mayor) que adquirirá de las productoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo a la crianza lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Campo Verde” (Green Pasture) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Juana is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling cheese, managing a neighborhood store, producing milk and cheese, and selling food.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Juana. She says that this is her second loan cycle since joining Pro Mujer. Juana received an invitation from a promoter of the organization who visited her at her house. She currently has a cattle business that she started several years ago. Juana gained knowledge as a girl by helping her family, which has helped her to manage this business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fodder in bulk, which she will acquire from the wholesale producers in her community. Afterwards, she will sell the animals that she raises from her vending post. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Juana is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juana said that she enjoys the loans that are offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy fodder in bulk.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh, head of the Sari Mertha group, has two children, and her husband works as a farmer. Ni Luh and nine other members of Sari Mertha group said they are grateful and thankful for the support they had. With the pig program, they can improve their standard of living because the income from the pig business has proven to be developing their welfare. They can support the needs of their families, education and savings.

And now, for the new loan they have, the Sari Mertha group wants to change their business into farming. They will use the loan to purchase various kind of seeds, farming tools and fertilizer. Now is the right season to plant cacao, corn and nut. Ni Luh will use her portion of loan to purchase fertilizer for her cacao and coconut. She will also purchase farming tools. She expects to improve the produce of her cacaos and coconuts. Together with her husband, she start to works in their garden at 9 a.m., after they've finished all the jobs at home, and finish at 4 p.m. With managing these two businesses (pigs and farming), she hopes for a better life, and of course, a better future.

loans.use: to purchase various kind of seeds, farming tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Teodisia

texts.en: Teodisia plants and harvests bananas and sells them in town to earn a living. For more than seven years, she has earned better income and had put up her business raising pigs. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying piglets and feeds. She was able to sustain the business and is now improving. Aside from this, she also had a retail business in their village and it gave an additional cash flow to the family. To offer more goods, she took a new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. Charito is married and has a shirt-printing business in the Philippines.

Charito requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like T-shirts, paints, etc., for her business.

Charito has been in this business for five years now.

Charito would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like T-shirts, paints, etc., for her business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 63 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming flowering plants in the Philippines. Jacinta is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase fertilizers for her plants.

Jacinta has been farming flowering plants for one year and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her plants

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 34 years old and married with one child who is in school. Marichu works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

Marichu has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is 55 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Dionisia has a computer gaming machine rental business in the Philippines. Dionisia requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional units and spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Dionisia has been in this business for 14 years. Dionisia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional units and spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Juliet is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 49 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emerita has a selling of dry goods business in the Philippines. Emerita requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods like slippers, pillows, pants, etc., to sell.

Emerita has been in this business for five years. Emerita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods like slippers, pillows, pants, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ester Luda

texts.en:
Ester Luda is driven by a passion in selling. She runs a store that primarily supports her family in Oroquieta. Every day, she never gets tired tending her store. Ester Luda is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventory of plasticware to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of plasticware to sell

loans.name: Sosorbaram

texts.en: Mr. Sosorbaram, 45 years old, lives with his wife and son in a slum district of Ulaanbaatar, where infrastructure is less developed and living conditions are very bad. However, Sosorbaram didn't give up on his dream of a better life. He works very hard; he almost always travels between districts searching for delivery jobs. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home, cooking and doing domestic work. Their son goes to high school and will graduate next year. The house his family lives in has been deteriorated over the years, and it needs some repair. So he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy building materials such as shingles, cement, fiberglass and foam. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica comenta que desde niña le ha gustado estudiar, ahora a los 18 años está siguiendo la carrera de contabilidad que es lo que le gusta.
Una de sus más grandes metas es recibirse de contadora, y trabajar bien, ejerciendo su profesión, ganando un sueldo que le ayude a mantener a sus padres, que desde siempre le ha apoyado en todo lo que ella necesite.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo, luchando por sus objetivos o metas.
texts.en:
Monica says that she enjoyed studying when she was a girl. Now she is 18 years old and pursuing a degree in Accounting, a subject that she enjoys.

Among her greatest goals are to become an accountant, work hard at her profession, and earn a salary that will enable her to support her parents who have always helped her with everything she has needed.

Monica is requesting this loan so that she can pay for her university fees. This will enable her to continue her studies as before as she strives to achieve her objectives and goals.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora: Es una señora amable y luchadora, tiene 44 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos: 2 mayores de edad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y primaria. Es enfermera. Desde hace muchos años ha vivido en una casa de tambo de madera, con 4 personas.  Con el propósito de construir su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar materiales: Cemento, madera zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano obra. Su sueño es construir un inodoro con fosa séptica y tener su propio pozo.
texts.en: Nora is a kind, hard-working woman who is 44 years old.  She is a single mother of four children, two adults and two adolescents who are in high school and elementary.  For many years she has lived in a wooden shed  with four people.  In an effort to build a concrete and wood house she is requesting her second loan to buy materials such as cement, wood, metal sheeting, nails, and to hire labor.  Her dream is to build a toilet with a septic tank and have her own well.

loans.use: To build a wood and concrete house.

loans.name: Jhony William

texts.es: Johny William: Es un señor alegre, originario de Rosita, tiene 33 años de edad, casado, con 3 hijos: 2 adolescentes que cursan su primaria y un recién nacido de 2 meses. Trabaja como operador en una institución del gobierno central. Su esposa vende ropa usada y confecciona ropa. Desde hace 7 años habita en casa de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de terminar de construir su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera, solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales: Cemento, bloque, madera zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano obra. Su sueño es instalarle cerámica y cielo razo a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Johny William is a cheerful man from Rosita.  He is 33 years old, married and has three children.  Two are adolescents in grade school and the third is a two-month old baby.  He works as an operator at an institution of the central government.  His wife sell used clothing and also works as a seamstress.

For seven years he has lived in a wood cabin.  In an effort to finish building his house with concrete and wood, he is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cement, blocks, wood, metal sheeting, nails and to hire labor.  His dream is to install tile and put up a fiber ceiling.

loans.use: To buy materials such as cement, blocks, metal sheeting, nails and to hire labor.

loans.name: Ramesh

texts.en:
Ramesh is a 48-year-old differently-abled man who lives with his wife and two children in Aanandpur, Odisha, India. He has one daughter and one son and both are in school. He is engaged in a tailoring service and he is expert in men's wear clothes-making. From this activity, he makes 5,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient for his family expenses, since his children are studying.

He is asking for this loan to purchase a new sewing machine and threads so he can make more men's wear clothes. He wants to educate his children and save some money for his future.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and threads

loans.name: Pradeep

texts.en:
Pradeep is 25-year-old differently-abled man living with his father, mother, wife, sister and two daughters ages six and four years old in the Ganjam District of Odisha, India. He owns a grocery shop where he sells rice, flour, sugar, edible oil, etc. He is also engaged in paddy cultivation as his father is a farmer engaged in paddy cultivation. All the family expenses are dependent on his grocery shop and paddy cultivation. His father helps him in both the activities.

Now he wants to expand his business, which is why he has requested this loan to buy grocery items in bulk such as rice, flour, sugar, edible oil, etc. so that he can make more money. He has a dream of making a house for his family.

Note: The man standing in the back of the shop is Pradeep's friend.

loans.use: to buy grocery items in bulk such as rice, flour, sugar and edible oil

loans.name: Marilu Jesús

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Marilú, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Marilu con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos para los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal y Oriflame (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días por ratos ya que ella no cuenta con horarios fijos para salir a sus recorridos ya que su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella en ocasiones también vende ropa y zapatillas pero solo en ciertos meses del año, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más 7 años en su negocio y le ha ido muy bien. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In San Ignacio, which is located in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the September 3rd Communal Bank meet every 15 days. Portoviejo is a place known for its hardworking people who dedicate themselves to agriculture and raising livestock.

Sra. Marilú lives in this place. She is 45 years old, married, and has six grown children. Three of them still live with her. Her husband is a mechanic.

With the intent of having her own income for the household expenses, Doña Marilú sells products from Yanbal and Oriflame (such as beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works every day whenever she has a spare moment, which means that she doesn’t have a set schedule. Marilú travels around and conducts her sales by going door-to-door. On a few occasions, she will also sell clothes and slippers, but only on certain months of the year. She extends credit and collects payments every eight days. Marilú has been in this business for more than seven years and is doing very well.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crèmes, and other products. She has participated in two loan cycles with her Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the loans have been a great help. Her dream is to move forward.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crèmes, and other products.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 40 años de edad soltera, madre de 2 hijos y se dedica a la venta de zapatos y administración de un taxi.
