Ella es una mujer de costumbres tradicionales, su lengua nativa es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio su forma de vestir es de pollera manta y sombrero (cholita) su negocio lo realiza en las distintas ferias de su ciudad de forma ambulante porque no tiene tienda fija.
Manuela es de carácter sociable, siempre trata de hacer amigos utilizando sus dos lenguas, ella lleva adelante dos negocios; la venta de zapatos y la administración de un auto que trabaja como taxi. De esa manera paga los gastos escolares y alimentación de sus dos hijos.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de venta mayorista, uno de los problemas que enfrenta es el mantenimiento y reparación de su taxi.
Es por esos motivos que Manuela solicita un préstamo para la reparación de su taxi y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de mantenimiento de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuela, 40, is single and has two children.  She sells shoes and manages a taxi.  A woman of traditional customs, she uses regional dress and hat; and her native language is Aymara, although she speaks Spanish for commerce purposes.  She sells her goods at the different fairs around the city because she does not have a shop.  

Manuela is sociable and always tries to make friends using both languages.  Through her shoe sales and taxi business she is able to cover her two children's education and food costs.

Her dream is to establish a wholesale business.  One of the problems she is up against is maintenance and repair of her taxi.  Therefore, Manuela is requesting a loan to repair her taxi so she can use the profit to support her children.

loans.use: To repair her taxi and cover her children's expenses.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 30 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Normanita

texts.en:
Normanita works hard to support her family. Normanita is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like canned goods, vegetables, spices, etc.

Normanita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Normanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like canned goods, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Balaram

texts.en:
Balaram is a 24-year-old differently abled man living with his father, mother, wife and son in a small village in the Puri District of Odisha, India. He is a knacker man. He purchase old items like bottles, wastage iron, etc. from people's doorsteps and sells them at the flea market. From this activity, he makes 4,000 INR per month.

He wants to purchase a new rickshaw (he has an old one) so he can easily move to the market and to people's doorsteps, and for that he is asking for a loan. He is a very hardworking and responsible man. He wants to open a shop in the flea market in the near future. He is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw

loans.name: Geovania

texts.es: Geovania del Municipio del Ayote, depende de su producción agrícola y Ganadera que obtiene de la tierra que cultiva, junto a su esposo aprovechan el potencial suelo realizando actividades del campo para mantener su humilde familia formada por ellos y sus dos hijos que estudian la primaria y en tiempos libres se integran al quehacer cotidiano para ir conociendo el manejo de la finca que será el patrimonio Heredados de sus padres.  Con el propósito de realizar un anexo a su vivienda se acerca a Afodenic para solicitar financiamiento mediante Kiva que tiene conocimiento de ello y es una manera de hacer realidad su sueño de comprar el material de Construcción como es Cemento, Hierro, Piedrin, Arena y pagar la mano de obra para construir un anexo en la parte de atrás de la vivienda que ocupará para cuarto de su hijo mayor que ya necesita privacidad.
texts.en:
Geovania is from the town of Ayote. She depends on her land for farming production and raising livestock. Geovania and her husband embrace the potential from their land by engaging in farming activities that help to sustain their humble family, which includes their two children who are in primary school. In her free time, Geovania takes care of the daily chores while managing the farm that she inherited from her parents.

In order to build an extension to her home, Geovania approached AFODENIC about requesting a Kiva loan since she was aware that it could help her to fulfill her dream. She will buy construction materials such as cement, iron, gravel, and sand, as well as pay for labor in order to build an extension at the back of her house. This will provide a room for her oldest son who is in need of privacy.

loans.use: to buy constructions materials and pay for labor in order to build an extension to her house.

loans.name: María Guillerma

texts.es:
María de 66 años de edad, no estudio en el tiempo que ella venia creciendo sus padres no le ayudaron para que estudiara,es madre soltera tiene dos hijas,una le ayuda a ella y la otra vive en estados unidos. María y una de sus hijas viven en una casa alquilada.

María desde hace veinte años se ha dedicado al negocio de frutas y verduras,el cual lo aprendió debido a que sola creció a sus hijas; ya que el padre de ellas las abandono cuando estaban pequeñas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en la 
terminal de buses eso implica levantarse muy temprano a las cuatro de la mañana.

 El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar unos medicamentos, ya que tiene que tenerlos de por vida e invertir otra parte para comprar mas frutas como: manzanas, guineos y otros productos que sus clientes buscan,de esa forma su calidad de vida mejorara.

El sueño de María es siempre mantener su negocio porque por medio de el pueden obtener mas ingresos y tener lo necesario para cada día.
texts.en:
María, 66, was unable to get an education because her parents did not help her to go to school.  She is a single mother with two children.  One of them helps her and the other one lives in the United States.  María lives in a rented house.

For 20 years Maria has earned an income selling fruits and vegetables which she learned to do alone in order to raise her daughters.  Their father left when they were little.  María's business is set up at the bus station which means she must get up very early at 4:00 a.m.

She will use the loan to buy medication for her chronic illness.  The rest will be used to buy more fruit such as apples, bananas and other products in demand by customers.  This will improve her quality of life.

Maria's goal is to maintain her business in order to earn more income and cover her daily needs.

loans.use: To buy medication for chronic illness and to buy more fruit such as apples, bananas and other products.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estela is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Estela has a frozen food vending business in the Philippines. Estela requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional packs of frozen food to sell to her customers.

Estela has been in this business for five years. In the future, Estela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional packs of frozen food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elva Yadira

texts.es:
Elva de 31 años de edad,  estudio enfermería, se encuentra soltera, madre de un hijo, ella tiene una librería de donde dependen sus ingresos.

Ella es graduada de enfermería desde hace 3 años, no ha encontrado un empleo estable, por el  momento solamente se encuentra brindando sus servicios como enfermera. Al negocio de la librería se dedica desde hace tres años.


El dinero será utilizado en la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio, estaría comprando papel bond, una fotocopiadora y una impresora, ya que con esto busca atraer más clientes. 

Elva sueña con encontrar un empleo formal, ampliar el negocio, obtener mejores ganancias, sacar adelante a su hijo y darle una vida digna.
texts.en:
Elva, 31, is single and has a son.  She studied nursing but earns a living with her stationery business.

Three years ago she received her nursing degree but was unable to find stable employment, so she established her business.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise such as bond paper, a photocopy machine and a printer to attract more customers.

Elva dreams of finding formal employment.  She also wants to expand her business and earn more profit so she can provide for her son and give him a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy bond paper, a photocopy machine and a printer to attract more customers.

loans.name: Leonor Edith

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Los Capuchinos.
En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 15 y 9 años, la  mayor  estudia en colegio y la menor en escuela. El marido trabaja en una institución privada.
Doña Leonor es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella también se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual tiene en su casa un pequeño galpón, al venderlos le dejan muy buenos ingresos que los utiliza para la educación de sus hijas.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella y su familia. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Los Capuchinos” meet every 15 days in the neighborhood of San Cristóbal in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. For many years, Portoviejo has been known as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” (The Royal Tamarind Trees).

Sra. Leonor lives in this place. She is 44 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two daughters (ages 15 and 9). The older daughter is in high school and the younger one is in elementary school. Her husband works at a private institution.

Doña Leonor is a housewife who generates her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells products from Avon and Yanbal (including beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Leonor works three days a week for two to three hours each day. She offers her products on credit and collects payments every eight days. Leonor also raises chickens in a small coop at her house. She generates a very good income from selling them, which helps to pay for her daughters’ education.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics. This is her fifth loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she enjoys being a member because the loans have been a great help to her and her family. Her dream is to provide the best for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cendrelina

texts.es: Cendrelina: Es una mujer amable y sociable, originaria de Rosita, tiene 28 años de edad, habita en la comunidad de Wasakin, ubicada a 15 km del municipio de Rosita, equivalente a una hora, casada tiene 4 hijos, 2 adolecentes que cursan su primaria y dos menores de edad. Su esposo cuenta con una experiencia de 14 años de ser docente. Con el propósito de generar sus propios ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 13 estableció una pequeña pulpería, en un anexo de su vivienda de tambo de madera, inicio con capital propio con C$ 5,000 (Cinco mil Córdobas Netos). Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Rosita y venderla a precios accesibles en su comunidad: Granos básicos, chiverías, sal, cloro, detergente, sopas y café instantáneas, rasuradoras, cuaderno, entre otros productos. Su sueño es diversificar su negocio, vender embutidos, carne molida, pollo, refrescos y helados de fruta y de leche, apoyar a que su esposo culmine su carrera universitaria de biología.
texts.en:
Cendrelina is a cheerful, sociable woman from Rosita.  She is 28 years old and lives in the community of Wasakin located 15 kilometers from the municipality of Rosita, which is about an hour away.  She and her husband have four children, two are in grade school and two are minors.  Her husband has worked as a teacher for 14 years.  

In an effort to generate her own income and help with the household expenses, 13 years ago Cendrelina set up a small grocery store.  It is annexed to her wood house and she started with C$5,000.  She is requesting her second loan to buy merchandise in Rosita to sell later in her community.  The goods include basic grains, snacks, salt, chlorine, detergent, instant soups and coffee, razors, notebooks and other products.  Her goal is to diversify her business and sell sausage, ground meat, chicken, soft drinks and ice cream.  She also wants to support her husband so he can finish his studies toward a Biology degree.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in Rosita and sell it at low prices in her community.  The goods include basic grains, snacks, salt, chlorine, detergent, instant soups and coffee, razors, notebooks, etc.

loans.name: Selena Liliveth

texts.es: Selena de 19 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con la venta de almuerzos que realiza los fines de semana desde hace 2 años. aAemás, elabora y vende tamales para tener un ingreso extra los cuales vende a domicilio, también su esposo apoya con los gastos del hogar gracias a su trabajo de mesero. Selena desea construir el baño de su casa por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillos, grava y mano de obra para la construcción del baño de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Selena is 19 years old and lives with her life companion. She is an enterprising woman who has been earning her living by selling lunches on the weekends. Selena has been doing this for two years. In addition, she prepares and sells tamales from her home as a way of earning extra income. Her husband helps with the household expenses, thanks to his job as a waiter.

Selena wants to build a bathroom in her house, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, and gravel. She will also pay for labor so that the bathroom in her house can be built.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es estudiante de Contabilidad, actualmente está estudiando el 5to año, comenta que la vida del estudiante es una lucha de cada día, su objetivo es terminar sus estudios para así poder poner un negocio propio.
Su estudio lo paga el, ya que su mamá falleció hace 4 años, de aquí a un tiempo se ve como un profesional y así para poder poner su negocio propio.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Pedro is in his fifth year as an Accounting student.  He says the life of a student is a daily struggle.  His goal is to finish his education so he can set up his own business.

He pays his own education costs because his mother passed away four years ago.  He believes he will become a professional eventually and can run his own business.

The loan he is requesting is to pay the university fees so he can continue his education.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es soltero, vive con mis padres en la ciudad de Pilar, está siguiendo la carrera de derecho, donde actualmente está cursando el 4to. Año.
Marcos comenta que también trabaja para solventar sus gastos y no depender de sus padres ya que ellos bastante ya lo han ayudado y una carrera universitaria es costosa. Espera poder terminar su carrera y ser una buena profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Marcos is single and lives with his parents in the city of Pilar. He is pursuing a degree in Law. Marcos is currently in his fourth year.

He says that he also works in order to cover his expenses since he does not rely on his parents, who have already helped quite a bit since a university degree is expensive. Marcos hopes to finish his degree and become a successful professional.

He is requesting a loan in order to cover his university fees. This will enable him to continue his studies as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris actualmente vive con su familia, está trabajando y por medio de ese trabajo se mantiene en cuanto a sus estudios. 
Está estudiando la carrera de contaduría pública. Comenta que su meta es llenar de satisfacción a sus padres, y llegar a terminar su carrera y formarse como profesional en el futuro para poder aportar su grano de arena en la sociedad y a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas de universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Doris lives with her family and works to cover her education costs.  She is studying public accounting and says her goal is to fill her parents with satisfaction.  She wants to finish her studies and get professional training so she can contribute to society and her family.

The loan she is requesting is to pay univesity fees so she can continue with her education.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, 55, lives in Phnom Kravanh district, Pursat province. She owns a farm on which she grows rice and sells the product to the local dealers. For almost 30 years, she has been a farmer. By working very hard, she is able to make approximately $3.00 per day.

Yon would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and have less smoke from wood or charcoal. Thanks to the green loan program with a special rate offered by HKL, Yon’s family can gain access to clean energy while protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Moek's Group

texts.en: Moek, a local farmer from Battambang province, is 63 years old and has four children. She strives for a living via rice farming on three hectares of farmland. This is not the first loan for Moek with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and now her living conditions are getting better than before. Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. For Moek, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Sinan

texts.en:
Sinan is 32 years old, a married woman with three children. All of her children are students. She is a sweet ground bean juice seller and she has been in this business for many years. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. They live in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Both of them can earn approximately $17 per day. Now she would like to request a loan of $1,500 to buy a newer motor for her husband to run as a motor taxi because her husband’s present motor is old. This loan will help her husband earn more income by using the newer motor. 

In the future, she wants to buy another motor for selling sweet ground bean juice in the village, fill the soil around her house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy a newer motor for her husband to run as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза родилась в 1987 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Фируза 7 лет назад начала свой бизнес, предоставлением услуги парикмахера. Она дополнительно научилась сделать миникюр и пидикюр. Постепенно год за годом она развевала свой бизнес. Фируза имеет своих клиентов. Ее клиенты попросили ее привести свадебные платья. Она теперь хочет открыть и свадебный салон. С такой целью она взяла на аренду помещение, теперь ей необходимо отремонтировать помещение, а также купить свадебные платья. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Firuza was born in 1987 and she is married with one son.  She started her business as a hairdresser seven years ago, and then she learned to give manicures and pedicures.  She has increased her business little by little over the years, and she has her own clients who have asked her to start offering wedding dresses.  Firuza now wants to open her own wedding salon and with that goal in mind, she has rented a retail space which she now needs to renovate, and she also needs to buy wedding dresses.  She is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to achieve this goal.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy wedding clothes and to repair the placement

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 48 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Pamela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more st to sell like noodles, spices, soap, shampoo, etc. She has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like noodles, spices, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Munduz

texts.ru: Мундуз 44 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Мундуз - средне-специальное бухгалтерское образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мундуз с 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Мундуз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 20 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 2,28 ГА, где Мундуз выращивает фасоль для реализации. Дополнительно в хозяйстве есть несколько тракторов и фасолеочистительный комбайн, посредством которых Мундуз и ее супруг предоставляют местным жителям сельскохозяйственные услуги. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мундуз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и лошади с жеребенком. Доходы от кредита Мундуз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение материального состояния своих детей.
texts.en:
Munduz is 44 years old and she is married with four children.  She has a specialized secondary education in accounting.  As the main source of income for her family, Munduz has been raising livestock and growing crops since 1995.  Thanks to her hard work, Munduz now has one dairy cow and 20 sheep, as well as a 2.28 hectare plot of land where she rows beans to sell.

There are also a few tractors and a bean-cleansing combine harvester, which Munduz and her husband rent out to the neighbors for a bit of additional income.  Their monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of increasing her business, Munduz has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and a horse with a foal.  She plans to use this loan to further increase her head of livestock, and she also plans to buy some items that will improve her children's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and a horse with a foal

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
Eufrocina is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eufrocina is 57 years old and has two children, who are still in school.

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Eufrocina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Genara is 47 years old and four of her children are currently in school.

Genara has a fishing business in the Philippines. Genara requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Genara has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Genara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana de 20 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 8 meses de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de pan francés y pan dulce desde hace 5 años, en donde además proporciona trabajo a otras personas. Ana desea construir un cuarto en su propiedad por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo, hierro, arena, cemento y grava para las paredes y lámina, polines y pines para el techo del cuarto, además para todos estos trabajos deberá pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Ana is 20 years old and lives with her partner and eight-month-old baby. Ana is an enterprising woman who has been making a living with a small business making and selling sweet and savoury breads for five years; Ana also provides employment to others through this business. Ana wants to build a bedroom on her property and so is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy bricks, iron, sand, cement and gravel for building walls, and metal sheeting, purlins and more for putting a roof on a bedroom. Ana will also use the loan to pay labourers to carry out this work.

loans.use: to buy bricks, iron, sand, cement and gravel for building walls, and metal sheeting, purlins and more for putting a roof on a bedroom.

loans.name: Riziki Mpya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Marie est une commerçante et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Riziki Mpya », entrepreneur, âgée de 41 ans, célibataire et mère de 1 enfants, qui est scolarisé. La cliente est  une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise à l’entrée de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son petit ami. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 kg du sucre, 50kg de riz, les huiles végétales et 5kg savon en poudre. Ainsi, elle compte acheter une parcelle la construire, vêtir, nourrir et scolariser son unique fils. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de  l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The customer, Marie, is a trader and member of the Riziki Moya business group. She is 41 years old, single and mother to one child, who goes to school. The customer sells food products and lays out her goods at the entrance to the town. She began her business with funds given to her by her boyfriend. She has been carrying out this business for the past ten years. This new loan will be used to buy 50 kilos of sugar, 50 kilos of rice, vegetable oils and five kilos of powdered soap. She is planning to buy a plot of land to build on, and to be able to clothe, feed and educate her only son. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for giving autonomy to female entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks, particularly during this critical post-conflict period in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilos of sugar, 50 kilos of rice, vegetable oils and five kilos of powdered soap.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur with her family. She has been selling fish in the local community for more than nine years to earn a living.  With her income, she was able to sustained the business and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for her fishing business. She started a piggery business from her generated income. She has taken a new loan recently to expand her pigpen. Rebecca is hoping to improve her piggery business in order to have a better future and to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to expand her pigpen

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Geraldine is 31 years old and has six children who are currently in school. Geraldine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Geraldine has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. Geraldine has been in this business for 6 years now. In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: El Volcán Group

texts.es: Pascuala es una persona de 43 años de edad, ( aparece en la foto de último de izquierda a derecha, viste güipil color rojo) vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene dos hijos; el primero tiene 20 años de edad, se graduó de maestro de educación, el segundo tiene 14 años de edad estudia primero básico, Pascuala obtiene sus ingresos por la elaboración y venta de ropa típica, vende en la comunidad donde vive y en las comunidades cercana, desde pequeña aprendió el oficio, ella comenta que es una actividad muy rentable porque le deja una buena ganancia y con ello ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, Pascuala necesita un crédito para comprar materia prima (hilos de diferentes colores)  para la elaboración de ropa típica, el sueño de Pascuala es que sus hijos se gradúen a nivel universitario.
texts.en: Pascuala (farthest to the right in the photo) lives in the municipality of Nahualá in Sololá. Pascuala has two children: the eldest is 20 years old and studied teaching, while the youngest is 14 years old and is in school. Pascuala makes a living producing and selling typical clothes. She sells these clothes in her local and surrounding communities. Pascuala learned this trade at a young age and says that it is very profitable as she earns good money. Pascuala uses her profits to help her husband pays household costs. Pascuala needs this loan in order to buy basic supplies (threads of different colours) in order to produce typical clothes. Pascuala's dream is for her children to graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy and sell typical clothes.

loans.name: Bon Samaritain Group

texts.fr: Agnes est une commerçante depuis 6 ans, vice présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Bon Samaritain»,  entrepreneur, âgée de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 étudient  et 3 sont encore petits. Elle est vendeuse de souliers plastiques au marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 48 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un technicien maçon. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser, nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en  apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en  leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en: Agnes has been a trader for six years and she is vice-president and a member of the Bon Samaritain business collective. She is a 31-year old entrepreneur, who is married and mother to six children, three of whom are at school and the other three who are still very young. She sells plastic shoes in the town's central market and is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy 48 pairs of shoes. Her husband is a skilled builder. She began her business with funds given to her by her husband. In the future she would like to be able to build a house, and also educate and feed her children. She is grateful to Hekima for having well chosen its objective, by supporting female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic bank system and granting them loans without any material guarantee, particularly in the post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 48 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: José de 34 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 15, 14, 12  y 10 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que ha aprendido varios oficios para poder sacar a delante a su familia. Entre los trabajos que realiza están pesca 3 veces por semana, carpintería a domicilio y en  reparaciones y elaboración de camas y juegos de comedor por temporadas, también se desempeña como albañil. José desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para pagar el derecho de energía y comprar materiales como alambre, tubos y pagará mano de obra para la instalación.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old and lives with his wife and four children, aged 15, 14, 12 and 10 years old. José is an enterprising man who has learned various trades in order to help his family to prosper. His various jobs include fishing three times a week, home carpentry jobs, and repairing and producing beds and dining room furniture. José also works as a builder. 

José wants to install electricity in his home and so is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to pay electricity rights; to buy materials such as wire and tubes; and to pay labourers; to install electricity in his home.

loans.use: to pay electricity rights; to buy materials such as wire and tubes; and to pay labourers; to install electricity in his home.
